Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We Are Waiting for You

Hi there!

I am Laura the recruiter for this position (and hopefully, your future colleague!).

First, a little bit about what I like the most about working at ServiZurich: The environment here is incredibly collaborative and innovative. Our tech-driven mindset fosters continuous learning and growth, creating an atmosphere where everyone can thrive. Now, I can't wait to share this exciting journey with you at the Zurich!

Let me take a wild guess: you‚Äôve probably sifted through countless job offers today, and they all seem to blur together. Sound familiar? Well, here‚Äôs the scoop: At Zurich, we might not have all the answers (and we‚Äôre not striving for perfection!), but we‚Äôve got something special. Curious? Keep reading!

First off, THANK YOU for considering our company. We understand that finding the right opportunity can be tough, but I‚Äôll try to make it easier.

Who Are We?

Let me introduce us. You‚Äôre reading about Zurich Insurance Group, a global leader in insurance, but this role specifically pertains to ServiZurich. Established in Barcelona in 2006, ServiZurich operates as an integral part of Zurich Insurance Group, providing cutting-edge technological solutions and support to Zurich's local and global business units.

In addition to our technological solutions, we excel in investment, administration, and accounting, ensuring comprehensive support for Zurich's diverse operations.

What Can You Expect?

Would you like to start your professional career in a multinational environment?

If you‚Äôre someone who wants to influence your own development, if you are passionate about data and analytics, someone that wants to be part of a young and motivated team and help us make a difference, this is your opportunity! We are seeking recent graduates, who are interested in developing their professional career in one of the world‚Äôs leading insurance groups through a personalized training and development program.

This position offers you the experience to learn within an international environment providing you support, mentoring and development opportunities in new projects.

And you might be thinking: This is great, what will my day-to-day be like, at Zurich? I‚Äôm glad you asked ‚Äì I asked myself the same question at the time.

In this role, you will be part of the Reporting and Analytics Team within Group Investment Management and perform the following duties:


Design and implement solutions based on data & analytics in Investment Management
Enable the business to draw actionable insights out of complex data sets
Translate reporting requirements into business intelligence solutions
Work alongside experts in various technological domains.
Enhance your skills with real-world experience
Contribute to a team that values your input and creativity.


Your role will involve building relationships with:


Stakeholders on local, regional and group levels
Investment back-office and middle-office teams
Market and Master Data teams
IT teams


What Makes You a Great Fit?

While we‚Äôre not seeking perfection or expecting you to save the world, we believe that if you meet some of these requirements, you‚Äôll be a fantastic fit for our team. We are waiting for you!

As a Junior Data Analyst your education and personal skills will ideally include:

Education skills:


Bachelor or Master¬¥s degree in either Finance, Economics, Information Technology and/or quantitative fields such as Statistics and Math with good academic record
Data Science studies are a plus
Fluent in written and spoken English


Technical skills:


Experience with data engineering and analysis
Experience with Power BI visualization tool is a must
Strong coding skills (preferably SQL, Python or Spark)
Proven analytical and problem-solving skills
Databricks knowledge is a plus
Machine Learning is a plus


Personal skills:


Ability to work with multi-cultural project teams and facilitating workshops with stakeholders
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Creative thinking and intellectual curiosity


The following areas of knowledge would be very helpful to a candidate to successfully fulfil this role:


Knowledge of data analytics including data transformation, modelling, and visualization
Business Analyst skills (e.g., requirement engineering, design thinking)
Understanding of insurance industry, financial products, financial markets as well as the main accounting principles


And‚Ä¶ What Makes Us Special?

As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus, we offer:


To support your work-life balance, we have adopted a flexible working model.
Over 300 euros to set up your home office and additional monthly home office allowance.
Wide range of internal and external trainings, including English and Spanish classes depending on the needs.
Ticket restaurant and Health Insurance with the flexibility to exchange it for other benefits.
Life and accident insurance.
Collective Life retirement Plan
2000 referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you to the company.
Special banking and insurance conditions plus Exclusive Employees discounts
Functional diversity benefits
Different social clubs such as hiking, investment, beach volley and many more


Where Are We Located?

Via Augusta, Barcelona.

We Are Waiting for You.

It‚Äôs a match? Don‚Äôt wait any longer! Apply by sending your CV in English.

If not, no worries! We‚Äôll meet again in the future. Feel free to share my contact details with anyone you think would be a great fit.

At Zurich, we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best-qualified individuals available, regardless of race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, or disability.

ServiZurich‚Äì Your Talent, Our Strength

Why Zurich

At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?

We are an equal opportunity employer who knows that each employee is unique - that‚Äôs what makes our team so great!

Join us as we constantly explore new ways to protect our customers and the planet.


Location(s): ES - Barcelona
Remote working: Hybrid
Schedule: Full Time
Recruiter name: Laura Santamar√≠a Rodr√≠guez

Well, here‚Äôs the scoop: At Zurich, we might not have all the answers (and we‚Äôre not striving for perfection!), but we‚Äôve got something special. Curious? Keep reading!

First off, THANK YOU for considering our company. We understand that finding the right opportunity can be tough, but I‚Äôll try to make it easier.

Who Are We?

Let me introduce us. You‚Äôre reading about Zurich Insurance Group, a global leader in insurance, but this role specifically pertains to ServiZurich. Established in Barcelona in 2006, ServiZurich operates as an integral part of Zurich Insurance Group, providing cutting-edge technological solutions and support to Zurich's local and global business units.

In addition to our technological solutions, we excel in investment, administration, and accounting, ensuring comprehensive support for Zurich's diverse operations.

What Can You Expect?

Would you like to start your professional career in a multinational environment?

If you‚Äôre someone who wants to influence your own development, if you are passionate about data and analytics, someone that wants to be part of a young and motivated team and help us make a difference, this is your opportunity! We are seeking recent graduates, who are interested in developing their professional career in one of the world‚Äôs leading insurance groups through a personalized training and development program.

This position offers you the experience to learn within an international environment providing you support, mentoring and development opportunities in new projects.

And you might be thinking: This is great, what will my day-to-day be like, at Zurich? I‚Äôm glad you asked ‚Äì I asked myself the same question at the time.

In this role, you will be part of the Reporting and Analytics Team within Group Investment Management and perform the following duties:

  • Design and implement solutions based on data & analytics in Investment Management
  • Enable the business to draw actionable insights out of complex data sets
  • Translate reporting requirements into business intelligence solutions
  • Work alongside experts in various technological domains.
  • Enhance your skills with real-world experience
  • Contribute to a team that values your input and creativity.

Your role will involve building relationships with:

  • Stakeholders on local, regional and group levels
  • Investment back-office and middle-office teams
  • Market and Master Data teams
  • IT teams

What Makes You a Great Fit?

While we‚Äôre not seeking perfection or expecting you to save the world, we believe that if you meet some of these requirements, you‚Äôll be a fantastic fit for our team. We are waiting for you!

As a Junior Data Analyst your education and personal skills will ideally include:

Education skills:

  • Bachelor or Master¬¥s degree in either Finance, Economics, Information Technology and/or quantitative fields such as Statistics and Math with good academic record
  • Data Science studies are a plus
  • Fluent in written and spoken English

Technical skills:

  • Experience with data engineering and analysis
  • Experience with Power BI visualization tool is a must
  • Strong coding skills (preferably SQL, Python or Spark)
  • Proven analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Databricks knowledge is a plus
  • Machine Learning is a plus

Personal skills:

  • Ability to work with multi-cultural project teams and facilitating workshops with stakeholders
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Creative thinking and intellectual curiosity

The following areas of knowledge would be very helpful to a candidate to successfully fulfil this role:

  • Knowledge of data analytics including data transformation, modelling, and visualization
  • Business Analyst skills (e.g., requirement engineering, design thinking)
  • Understanding of insurance industry, financial products, financial markets as well as the main accounting principles

And‚Ä¶ What Makes Us Special?

As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus, we offer:

  • To support your work-life balance, we have adopted a flexible working model.
  • Over 300 euros to set up your home office and additional monthly home office allowance.
  • Wide range of internal and external trainings, including English and Spanish classes depending on the needs.
  • Ticket restaurant and Health Insurance with the flexibility to exchange it for other benefits.
  • Life and accident insurance.
  • Collective Life retirement Plan
  • 2000 referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you to the company.
  • Special banking and insurance conditions plus Exclusive Employees discounts
  • Functional diversity benefits
  • Different social clubs such as hiking, investment, beach volley and many more

Where Are We Located?

Via Augusta, Barcelona.

We Are Waiting for You.

It‚Äôs a match? Don‚Äôt wait any longer! Apply by sending your CV in English.

If not, no worries! We‚Äôll meet again in the future. Feel free to share my contact details with anyone you think would be a great fit.

At Zurich, we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best-qualified individuals available, regardless of race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, or disability.

ServiZurich‚Äì Your Talent, Our Strength

Why Zurich

At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?

We are an equal opportunity employer who knows that each employee is unique - that‚Äôs what makes our team so great!

Join us as we constantly explore new ways to protect our customers and the planet.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Barcelona - Spain

Flexible working: 60% home office / week‚ÄØ

Job type: Permanent, Full time‚ÄØ - Hybrid

About The Job

At Sanofi, we're committed to providing next-gen healthcare through the power of data insights and AI. As a Data Engineer in our Manufacturing & Supply Digital Data Foundations team, you'll play a crucial role in transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive innovation and business value. You'll be part of an exciting journey to revolutionize our manufacturing processes through data-driven decision making.

We are an innovative global healthcare company with one purpose: to chase the miracles of science to improve people's lives. Our Digital Data & Technology organization is transforming Sanofi into an AI-driven powerhouse, creating trusted, high-quality data platforms that enable better decision-making across our global operations.

Main Responsibilities


Design and implement robust data engineering pipelines for Manufacturing & Supply systems, including SAP S4/HANA, QMS, LIMS, and MES
Create and maintain data integration solutions with comprehensive lifecycle management
Develop data visualization solutions using design-thinking approaches to deliver high-value products
Collaborate with cross-functional teams in agile pods to understand and translate business requirements
Ensure data quality and compliance with regulatory requirements (Data Privacy, GxP, SOX)
Build and optimize data models to support Manufacturing & Supply analytics needs


About You


Experience in data engineering and ETL/ELT development, particularly with Informatica/IICS and DBT/Airflow
Strong SQL skills and proficiency in Python for data transformation
Knowledge of data governance principles and quality assessment methodologies
Experience with cloud technologies, preferably AWS
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related field
Agile mindset with excellent communication and collaboration skills


Why choose us?


Drive innovation at the intersection of healthcare and technology
Develop your expertise with cutting-edge data and AI platforms
Enjoy a thoughtful rewards package that recognizes your contribution
Take advantage of flexible working arrangements and comprehensive health benefits
Work with global teams on transformative digital initiatives
Access continuous learning opportunities and career growth paths


nullPursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Join Sanofi and step into a new era of science - where your growth can be just as transformative as the work we do. We invest in you to reach further, think faster, and do what‚Äôs never-been-done-before. You‚Äôll help push boundaries, challenge convention, and build smarter solutions that reach the communities we serve. Ready to chase the miracles of science and improve people‚Äôs lives? Let‚Äôs Pursue Progress and Discover Extraordinary ‚Äì together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

  • Dominio avanzado de Excel y SQL y nivel alto de programaci√≥n en Visual Basic, SQL y ORACLE, as√≠ como en la gesti√≥n de bases de datos.
  • Valoraremos positivamente tener conocimientos en herramientas de gesti√≥n de riesgos o ALM (Ambit Focus, Bancware o herramienta equivalente).
  • Se valorar√° tener conocimientos de la normativa contable de entidades de cr√©dito, as√≠ como conocer los estados financieros FINREP.

Banco Sabadell est√° comprometido en promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, procurando el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selecci√≥n, formaci√≥n y promoci√≥n ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminaci√≥n por motivo de g√©nero, edad, orientaci√≥n sexual, religi√≥n, etnia o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social.

Title: Data Analyst Junior- Control Tower
Description:
Description

The EU External Fulfilment (EF) network consists of circa 35 operations which offer flexible solutions to the CF network operated by external providers (3PL providers). EU EF primarily provides: (1) network capacity solutions (storage/throughput), (2) special operation solutions (Hazmat, BWS, IXD, SDC, ICC, etc) and (3) emerging market penetration solutions. EU EF is currently undergoing an operational transformation, driving demand for enhanced expertise in Outbound (OB).

The goal of EU 3PL Control Tower is to provide an excellent operational end to end, 24/7 support, in 3PL buildings across European/UK External Fulfillment chain. We aim to provide the standardized and optimized process with frustration free communication. This role is for a highly driven and motivated individual with operational experience and innovative, hands-on approach.

This position involves the daily operational tasks resolutions and day to day communication with 3PL and Amazon team of problem solvers and node managers on their KPIs management.

The successful candidate will be responsible for: a- Provide reactive/proactive support to 3PL Providers and Amazon internals, b- Work on internal Projects to improve/automate 3PL Control Tower services. This person has a strong delivery record, attention to details and will be able to work independently with limited supervision.

This job involves 3PL operations monitoring and ops support, within a team that covers 24/7 shift pattern, for 30+ buildings in Europe/UK.

The shift to cover is Night Shift: 10pm CET to 6am CET, Sunday to Thursday (Friday and Saturday: days off).

Key job responsibilities


Providing the operational guidance to 3PL
Being a communication bridge between 3PL and Amazon stakeholders
Mitigating CX risk by CPT management support, resolving OB errors and managing shipment cancellations
Supporting on Transportation escalations.
Uploading critical data for supply chain and transportation visibility
Checking process and Amazon standard compliance
Optimization of actual Control Tower Outbound processes, aiming to automatize the actual tasks of the team, applying BI skills.
Work on Projects to improve actual 3PL Control Tower services, and capture new services that can be scalable to all 3PL sites.


Basic Qualifications


- Relevant experience working with the MS Office suite (Word, Excel, Outlook)
- C1 English level
- Spanish C2 level


Preferred Qualifications


High school or equivalent diploma.
Focus on details and analytical approach.
Expertise in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, AI, etc.
Experience in logistics.


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Job ID: A3046653

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft is a global leader in gaming with teams across the world creating original and memorable gaming experiences, from Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Rainbow Six, to Just Dance and more. We believe diverse perspectives help both players and teams thrive. If you‚Äôre passionate about innovation and pushing entertainment boundaries, join our journey and help us create the unknown!

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile‚ÄØbrings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we‚Äôre transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft‚Äôs Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team and will be reporting to our Director of Data & Analytics. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you‚Äôll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid work model.
Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flexible working hours: 40-hour workweek with start times between 8 AM and 10 AM (or from 7:30 AM when working onsite to avoid traffic jams), and early leave from 4 PM (Fridays from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule‚ÄØ(35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours:‚ÄØ24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays:‚ÄØ25 days per year + 1 day in your‚ÄØUbi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday‚ÄØdays‚ÄØon the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 210‚Ç¨ per month, and‚ÄØFlexible compensation plan‚ÄØ(Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance‚ÄØwith Cigna, including‚ÄØPhysiotherapist & Psychology sessions‚ÄØwith a reduced price.
Life Insurance‚ÄØwith AXA.
Mobile Device‚ÄØGrant‚ÄØof 400 EUR‚ÄØstarting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings‚ÄØin English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount‚ÄØand Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee‚ÄØby INCAPTO (it‚Äôs very, very good).



Ubisoft is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our player community. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, religion, gender sexual orientation, age or disability status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Kiwi.com

Kiwi.com is a leading global travel-tech company headquartered in the Czech Republic. Our innovative algorithm enables users to find better route options and prices other search engines can‚Äôt see, daily performing billions of price checks across 95% of global flight content. Are you bold, bright and curious? Join a global business that‚Äôs still got a start-up heart.

About Our Content Analytics Team

Our team is responsible for providing data-centric insights that enable the optimization of our flight content acquisition and processing. We use extensive datasets to support booking channel performance, improve autobooking efficiency and ensure data quality across our systems. Our work directly impacts Kiwi.com 's ability to offer our customers unique travel combinations and a smooth booking experience worldwide. We combine technical expertise with business understanding to build data-informed recommendations across multiple teams and stakeholders.

What You Will Do


You will conduct complex ad-hoc analysis using BigQuery and Looker, delivering insights that support thoughtful decision-making.
By creating and maintaining dashboards for key business metrics, you will help make data accessible and meaningful for stakeholders.
You will work with Looker's analytical layer, defining explores, measures and dimensions to support robust data exploration.
You will collaborate on building data models and support data quality through rigorous QA processes in collaboration with our data engineers.
You will evaluate and improve our complex flight booking and data acquisition systems, identifying opportunities for optimization.
You‚Äôll create data-informed recommendations by sharing practical insights with our flight content ecosystem.
You will help develop monitoring and alerting tools for product operations, enabling proactive incident detection and prevention.


What You Will Need


Your strong SQL skills and experience with BigQuery or similar data warehouses.
You have experience with BI tools (we use Looker) and a solid understanding of data modeling and data quality standards.
You can translate complex analytical findings into actionable insights that drive results.
You bring experience working with large datasets and collaborating with multiple stakeholders across teams.
Your excellent communication skills in English enable you to explain complex concepts to non-technical audiences.
You have an analytical mindset with a strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and precision in your work.
You are capable of working independently while aligning with and contributing to team goals.


We offer you

About Kiwi.com

Kiwi.com is a leading global travel-tech company headquartered in the Czech Republic. Our innovative algorithm enables users to find better route options and prices other search engines can‚Äôt see, daily performing billions of price checks across 95% of global flight content. Are you bold, bright and curious? Join a global business that‚Äôs still got a start-up heart.

About Our Content Analytics Team

Our team is responsible for providing data-centric insights that enable the optimization of our flight content acquisition and processing. We use extensive datasets to support booking channel performance, improve autobooking efficiency and ensure data quality across our systems. Our work directly impacts Kiwi.com 's ability to offer our customers unique travel combinations and a smooth booking experience worldwide. We combine technical expertise with business understanding to build data-informed recommendations across multiple teams and stakeholders.

What You Will Do

  • You will conduct complex ad-hoc analysis using BigQuery and Looker, delivering insights that support thoughtful decision-making.
  • By creating and maintaining dashboards for key business metrics, you will help make data accessible and meaningful for stakeholders.
  • You will work with Looker's analytical layer, defining explores, measures and dimensions to support robust data exploration.
  • You will collaborate on building data models and support data quality through rigorous QA processes in collaboration with our data engineers.
  • You will evaluate and improve our complex flight booking and data acquisition systems, identifying opportunities for optimization.
  • You‚Äôll create data-informed recommendations by sharing practical insights with our flight content ecosystem.
  • You will help develop monitoring and alerting tools for product operations, enabling proactive incident detection and prevention.

What You Will Need

  • Your strong SQL skills and experience with BigQuery or similar data warehouses.
  • You have experience with BI tools (we use Looker) and a solid understanding of data modeling and data quality standards.
  • You can translate complex analytical findings into actionable insights that drive results.
  • You bring experience working with large datasets and collaborating with multiple stakeholders across teams.
  • Your excellent communication skills in English enable you to explain complex concepts to non-technical audiences.
  • You have an analytical mindset with a strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and precision in your work.
  • You are capable of working independently while aligning with and contributing to team goals.

We offer you

  • We offer a hybrid and flexible work environment. A lovely, modern office in the center of Barcelona (Passeig de Gracia) with great views and amenities.
  • Monthly entitlement of 200 Euro redeemable through Cobee. Cobee is a benefits platform offering a range of benefits (meals, transport, nursery, health insurance, and physical wellness) and flexible compensation. It also allows our employees to allocate up to 30% of their gross salary to the consumption of certain products or services, leveraging tax exemption.
  • We also enjoy benefits, such as flexible working hours, 30 paid vacation days and sick days.
  • Annual financial bonus based on company and individual performance.
  • Flight vouchers to celebrate your Kiwi anniversaries.
  • Relocation package (including visa transfer support).
  • Dogs are welcome in our offices.

Title: Data Analyst - Business Performance Analytics
Description:
What You'll Do:

As part of the Business Performance Analytics (BPAX) team within Sales Strategy, your primary mission will be to deliver robust, intuitive, and actionable business insights that empower Criteo‚Äôs CRO and Commercial leaders to shape and drive the company‚Äôs commercial strategy.

You will apply a data-driven approach to uncover insights and explain business performance. This role involves working with large and complex datasets, requiring strong analytical curiosity, creativity in data exploration, and the ability to synthesize findings into a compelling narrative that supports strategic decision-making.

Your Mission


Build advanced analytical views to decode and communicate global performance patterns
Perform in-depth competitive analyses, measuring the business impact of competitors‚Äô activities across key markets
Leverage external and internal data to understand client behavior, identify high-value client clusters (e.g., through CLTV studies), and qualify the potential of clients and prospects across new and existing business areas
Size business growth opportunities and risks, and translating findings into actionable recommendations for multiple levels of stakeholders



Who You Are:


2‚Äì3 years of experience in a similar analytics role (experience in AdTech is a plus)
A Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (e.g., Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or Business)
Strong analytical skills and intellectual curiosity, with the ability to structure and solve complex problems
Solid understanding of statistical modeling and data interpretation
Hands-on experience with SQL for data manipulation and extraction
Proficiency in Python for data analysis
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI and/or Tableau
Strong presentation skills (including PowerPoint), with the ability to translate complex data into clear business insights and actionable recommendations
Business acumen and the ability to act as a trusted advisor to commercial stakeholders
Excellent communication skills and fluency in English
A proactive, autonomous mindset, with the ability to manage multiple projects, set milestones, coordinate with cross-functional teams, and drive initiatives forward



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is a leader in commerce media, helping brands, agencies, and publishers create meaningful consumer connections through AI-powered advertising solutions. We‚Äôre shaping a more open and sustainable digital future for advertising.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices across the globe or from the comfort of home, our 3,600 Criteos collaborate together to build an open, impactful, and forward-thinking environment.

We foster a workplace where everyone is valued, and employment decisions are based solely on skills, qualifications, and business needs‚Äînever on non-job-related factors or legally protected characteristics.

What We Offer:

üè† Own your work style ‚Äì Build your work around your life and not the other way around.

üìà Grow with us ‚Äì Learning, mentorship & career development programs.

üí™ Your wellbeing matters ‚Äì Health benefits, wellness perks & mental health support.

ü§ù A team that cares ‚Äì Diverse, inclusive, and globally connected.

üí∏ Fair pay & perks ‚Äì Competitive salary, equity, performance-based rewards and family-friendly policies.

Additional benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Quick Commerce
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Quick-Commerce team focused on our non-integrated and long-tail partners. Contribute to the creation of our next generation platform, that works on expanding our amazing delivery to new products such as groceries, pharmaceuticals, flowers and more. Work on warehouse management systems, our shopper app and our customer facing systems. If you're a creative problem solver who is eager to deliver solutions and hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the amazing city of Barcelona!


You will work on our next-generation platform to not only provide groceries for our hungry customers but also other daily urgent needs like drinks, fruits, snacks but also batteries.
You will collaborate closely with product managers, engineering leaders, and leadership across Q-Commerce.
Troubleshoot issues, Identify complex problems and analyze potential solutions including workarounds as well as provide timely fixes.
Identify opportunities for our non-integrated vendors based on the available data. Raise missing data points that could benefit our partners.
Generate an automatic framework for providing insights
You will work in a goal-driven environment.


Qualifications


Relevant work experience in Analytics, Business Intelligence or comparable functions within organizations focused on ecommerce.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with at least one data visualization tool (e.g., Looker, Tableau).
Familiarity with mathematical and statistical data analysis techniques (such as regression, extrapolation, time series analysis, forecasting, statistical hypothesis testing and econometric models)
Experience with tools such as Pandas, Numpy y/o Scikit Learn
Deep understanding of ecommerce data and ecosystem.
Python or any other backend language knowledge.
Define some basic classification models based on the vendors data analysis
Understanding of data pipelines
You believe in cross-functional teams and know that responsibility does not end with release of a feature.
Fluent English communication skills.


Additional Information

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We believe driven talent deserves:


üçî Monthly Glovo credits to satisfy your cravings!
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Analyst - Internship - Barcelona
Description:

Data Analyst - Internship - Barcelona


Barcelona
Internship
Apply Now


About

We are papernest

Our ambition? To be the one and only platform to manage all the subscriptions with one single click.

Since our launch in 2015 we haven‚Äôt stopped growing: we are now more than 800 employees, 1.5 million users, and we work in 3 European markets and have offices in Paris, Reims, Barcelona and Warsaw.

We are convinced that all great success comes first and foremost from a great team !

Job Description

This year marks 10 years since we launched our idea: to simplify our customers' lives by offering an innovative solution to easily subscribe to, manage, and change all types of contracts through a single, intuitive platform.

Since then, we have supported over 1.5 million customers in France, Spain, and Italy, while investing in new verticals. This has positioned us as a high-performing, innovative, and competitive scale-up in a fast-growing market.

With over 900 employees across 3 locations, we are consolidating our position as a leader in the European market. We are always looking for talented individuals ready to join a committed and motivated team driven by a purpose-driven mission. Working with us means embracing a culture of excellence, innovation, and real impact.

As a Data Analyst Intern based in our Barcelona office, you will actively work on diverse data challenges to help the team solve problems, become more efficient, and iterate faster by leveraging reliable data. We are looking for an intern for a 6-month period starting in January 2026.

Your Future Missions

Create value through analytics:


Perform ad hoc analyses to support decision-making, identify growth opportunities, and propose operational improvements.
Automate team tasks by creating new, innovative tools.


Ensure Data Reliability And Accessibility


Guarantee the reliability of data from various sources.
Maintain and develop dashboards to make data accessible to the operations team.


Implement alert systems to identify potential issues and anticipate market changes.

Support Our Business Teams


Automate the calculation of commissions for our sales team of over 400 people across France, Spain, and Italy.
Calculate and automate compensation for our strategic partners.
Build prioritization models for managing leads to maximize customer conversion rates.
Monitor partner performance by building and visualizing key indicators.


Your Profile


You are a graduate of an engineering or business school.
You are passionate about data and the digital world.
You are meticulous, resourceful, and independent.
You are proficient with SQL, data processing, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker).
Experience with data science is a strong plus.
You are proficient in English.


Additional Information


Contract Type: Internship
Location: Barcelona
Possible partial remote


Apply Now

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
The Swiss-based DocMorris AG is a leading company in the fields of online pharmacy, marketplace and professional healthcare with strong brands in Germany and other European countries. With its business model, DocMorris offers its patients, customers and partners a broad range of products and services. In doing so, DocMorris is pursuing its vision of creating a digital health ecosystem for everyone to manage their health in one click.

In Spain and France, the company operates the leading marketplace for health and personal care products in Southern Europe. With an innovative business model, our marketplace does not manage stock or warehouses, it integrates the catalog of products, pricing, and stock levels of the most important and trusted off-line pharmacies in a single website, achieving 24h delivery service for more than 200.000 products and 10.000 brands from more than 1.000 pharmacies and health stores. Our business model and service have received several awards like the prize for Best Webshop in Spain as well as the Best Mobile App from the E-Commerce Awards.

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our Data team, reporting to the Head of Data and working side by side with the business, finance, marketing, and engineering teams, to help extract the full value from our data in order to ask and answer questions, make decisions, and optimize, all to improve the experience for our customers and marketplace sellers by helping our internal teams with the appropriate data and reports.

Tasks and Responsibilities:


Follow-up and analysis of the main KPIs related to marketing, business, operations and finance in order to detect deviations, propose improvement actions, facilitate the decision-making process, and to detect/prevent potential loss of business faster.
Continuous development of efficient/automated reporting dashboards, tools, and processes to support decision-making.
Assisting stakeholders in the usage of the various existing systems and datasets available within the company and driving the development of new solutions.
Ad-hoc analysis to assist different teams in the decision making process, such as evaluating the performance of A/B Tests.
Prepare the monthly presentations for Business review meetings and Boards.
Support CFO, CMO, Marketing managers and SEO manager in the process of preparing the annual Budget and Rolling forecast.
Collaborate with and support the different teams inside the company, serving as the link and translator between these stakeholders and the data team, managing, clarifying, and defining their requests.


What we are looking for:


Professional Experience:
Minimum 2 year experience as a Data Analyst.
Experience in a customer-centric company, preferably e-commerce, transactional marketplace, or e-health, is a plus.
People Skills:
Excellence: in organization, planning and execution. Focus on details and ability to work under pressure and prioritize. Experience with Agile is a plus.
Proactivity: proposes new ideas and is able to work independently.
Ownership: takes on every challenge with responsibility until we find the solution. Problem solving mind-set.
Team: accustomed to collaborating with many stakeholders from multiple departments, solving problems together and sharing in achievements, failures, successes.
Highly analytical skills: obsession with data and continuous improvement.
Professional Skills:
Proficiency in the use of Excel.
Experience using a BI tool. Qlik Sense is a plus.
Good command of SQL.
Knowledge of Python or similar programming language.
Languages: Spanish and English (proficiency).
Domain knowledge (marketing, business, finance, operations, logistics) is a plus.


Our Benefits


Ticket restaurant 11‚Ç¨/day worked
25 days of holiday
Birthday day-off + 50‚Ç¨ voucher to spend on our website!
Health insurance with Sanitas is paid by PromoFarma (for those who want it!)
Social benefits package. You can dedicate a part of your gross salary to Ticket Transport or Nursery.
Opportunity to participate in the employee participation program (stock options)
10% discount on our website on each purchase and up to 30% discount on DocMorris branded products
Access to eLearning platforms such as LinkedIn Learning
Individual training opportunities and budget for personal development
Access to corporate wellness plattform "Wellhub" (ex Gympass) with various offers on gyms, studios, guided classes, workouts and wellness app
Access to mobile consultations with medical specialists, lawyers or veterinarians via "Doctor i "
Great employee events and annual company celebrations


Show more

  • Support CFO, CMO, Marketing managers and SEO manager in the process of preparing the annual Budget and Rolling forecast.
  • Collaborate with and support the different teams inside the company, serving as the link and translator between these stakeholders and the data team, managing, clarifying, and defining their requests.

What we are looking for:

  • Professional Experience:
  • Minimum 2 year experience as a Data Analyst.
  • Experience in a customer-centric company, preferably e-commerce, transactional marketplace, or e-health, is a plus.
  • People Skills:
  • Excellence: in organization, planning and execution. Focus on details and ability to work under pressure and prioritize. Experience with Agile is a plus.
  • Proactivity: proposes new ideas and is able to work independently.
  • Ownership: takes on every challenge with responsibility until we find the solution. Problem solving mind-set.
  • Team: accustomed to collaborating with many stakeholders from multiple departments, solving problems together and sharing in achievements, failures, successes.
  • Highly analytical skills: obsession with data and continuous improvement.
  • Professional Skills:
  • Proficiency in the use of Excel.
  • Experience using a BI tool. Qlik Sense is a plus.
  • Good command of SQL.
  • Knowledge of Python or similar programming language.
  • Languages: Spanish and English (proficiency).
  • Domain knowledge (marketing, business, finance, operations, logistics) is a plus.

Our Benefits

  • Ticket restaurant 11‚Ç¨/day worked
  • 25 days of holiday
  • Birthday day-off + 50‚Ç¨ voucher to spend on our website!
  • Health insurance with Sanitas is paid by PromoFarma (for those who want it!)
  • Social benefits package. You can dedicate a part of your gross salary to Ticket Transport or Nursery.
  • Opportunity to participate in the employee participation program (stock options)
  • 10% discount on our website on each purchase and up to 30% discount on DocMorris branded products
  • Access to eLearning platforms such as LinkedIn Learning
  • Individual training opportunities and budget for personal development
  • Access to corporate wellness plattform "Wellhub" (ex Gympass) with various offers on gyms, studios, guided classes, workouts and wellness app
  • Access to mobile consultations with medical specialists, lawyers or veterinarians via "Doctor i "
  • Great employee events and annual company celebrations

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Smadex is a leading advertising technology company founded in Barcelona in 2011 and sold to American-based and stock-listed Entravision in 2018 (NYSE::EVC). We are a fully transparent platform built with top technology, countless programmatic management features and powerful machine learning algorithms to help advertisers grow their business at scale. We are currently considered one of the top mobile ad-tech companies in the world.

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to work closely with the ML and Product teams. The candidate should be communicative and analytical, in order to answer the complex questions that Product and Campaign performance are facing. For this purpose we use tons of data available to get powerful insights to resolve them, creating effective strategies to help improve the Smadex platform!¬†

This is a full-time position based in Barcelona.

Your tasks and responsibilities:

Analyze large, complex data sets containing the behaviour of millions of mobile users and Apps worldwide to influence Product & ML strategies.¬†
Working cross-functionally with business and technical teams to support product performance.
Develop dashboards and processes to ensure data influences decisions at all levels of the company.

Skills and requirements:

3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst / Data Scientist.
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in a Quantitative Field (Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science).
Strong problem-solving skills, ability to formulate questions, run analysis to articulate a recommendation.
Proven working knowledge of Python, SQL and large data sets, understanding of analytic methodologies for data evaluation.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present analysis and conclusions.
Strong knowledge and experience of statistical concepts and hypothesis testing.
Knowledge of the ad-tech industry is a plus.

Please note that we do NOT provide VISA sponsorship. Candidates without a legal permit to work in Spain won't be considered.

What is in it for you:

Integrate a highly motivated, young and dynamic team
Great compensation package
Top location at the heart of Barcelona with a rooftop terrace, Barbecue, and a fully stocked fridge
Great work-life balance: work from home (2 days per week), flexible hours
LinkedIn Learning and training opportunities
Meal vouchers - Ticket Restaurant monthly allowance
Monthly gym allowance to use in up to 30 DIR gyms around the city
Monthly TGIF events
Regular team-building events
Fun and friendly work environment with talented marketers and engineers from over 28 countries
And more!

Title: Finance Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

At Docplanner Group, we‚Äôre on a mission to help people live longer, healthier lives. As the world‚Äôs largest healthcare platform, each month, we connect 24 million patients with 280k doctors across 13 countries (through brands like ZnanyLekarz, Doctoralia, MioDottore, DoktorTakvimi, and jameda). Our marketplaces, SaaS and AI tools simplify daily tasks and help doctors, clinics and hospitals work more efficiently, so they can focus on what really matters: caring for their patients.

Learn more about our products here: pro.doctoralia.es

Why Join Us?


üìä Real impact ‚Äì We help doctors help patients. Your work truly makes a difference.
üìà At scale, yet agile ‚Äì 3,000+ employees, but still fast, flexible, and hands-on.
üí∞ Pre-IPO & growing ‚Äì We‚Äôre backed by leading VC funds including One Peak Partners, Goldman Sachs Asset Management, and Point Nine Capital, raising a total of approx. ‚Ç¨400m to date. Now, we‚Äôre focused on profitability and IPO preparation. It‚Äôs an exciting time to join us.
‚ú® Shape the future, sustain growth ‚Äì Make a difference now *and* build for long-term success.


Job Description

The new team member, working within the Financial Reporting team, will play a key role in supporting the evolution of financial reporting in a challenging and stimulating environment. You will help bridge the gap between finance and BI. Our primary objective is to assist the business in making decisions based on data, with a particular emphasis on producing reports as the primary and most reliable source of information.

A team of 12 experts provides support to various departments, including marketing, sales, customer success, finance, and people experience, for both short-term and long-term projects. Collaborating closely with stakeholders, we strive to develop reports, analyses, models, and recommendations that enable us to gain a deep understanding of how we can enhance the satisfaction of both doctors and patients.

You will be an integral part of the Financial Reporting team, working closely with the Data Analytics team to support business decisions based on data.

How would you be impacting our mission


Financial Reporting and Analysis: Track key financial metrics and KPIs, ensuring they align with organizational goals; Develop and maintain comprehensive financial dashboards using advanced BI tools; Provide detailed insights into financial performance, trends, and variances; Provide insights for long-term strategic decisions;
Data Management and Integration: Ensure accurate and timely collection of financial data from systems like Oracle NetSuite; Integrate data from multiple sources for a unified financial view;
Performance Measurement: Analyze profitability and cost efficiency to identify improvement areas;
Regulatory and Compliance Reporting: Support audits and for regulatory documentation;
Automation and Process Improvement: Automate repetitive financial tasks to improve efficiency; Implement process improvements to reduce manual efforts and errors;
Enhanced Reporting and Visualization: Utilize BI tools like Tableau for dynamic, interactive reports and dashboards; Enhance report quality and accessibility beyond traditional spreadsheets.


Qualifications

What will help you thrive?


Bachelor's degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Demonstrable experience in using SQL to derive actionable insights, either in commercial or academic setting (must have).
Knowledge of Python/R and desire to expand your knowledge.
Experience with statistical modeling and descriptive statistics.
Experience in partnership with internal stakeholders.
Experience in leading and executing end to end BI projects.
Strong written and oral communication skills in English; proficiency in other languages such as German, Spanish, and Italian is a plus.
Ability to gather, organize, analyze, and report large volumes of financial data with speed and accuracy.
Strong attention to detail with the ability to provide high-quality work efficiently.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to adapt and work in a quickly changing environment, managing competing demands.


Which skills are ‚Äòbonus points‚Äô?


Master's degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Able to take a step back from the technicalities and examine them through a business lens.
Open to cooperating with a lot of people from many teams in different countries.
Like to see the instant effects of your work.
Knowledge of ERP finance applications (Oracle, Oracle - NetSuite, SAP).
Relevant experience in accounting and financial reporting.


Additional Information

What to Expect from Our Hiring Process

Role

We like to keep things transparent and efficient! Here‚Äôs what the process usually looks like (though it might vary slightly depending on the role):

1Ô∏è‚É£ Intro Chat ‚Äì A first call with our Talent Acquisition Partner to explore mutual fit around relevant skills, value alignment, and motivation.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Hiring Manager Interview ‚Äì A deeper dive into your experience and aspirations with your future manager, who you‚Äôll be reporting to in this role. Take this chance to ask anything on your mind‚Äîit‚Äôs just as much about making sure we‚Äôre the right fit for you, too.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Second Hiring Manager Interview

4Ô∏è‚É£ Business Case Presentation & Team Meeting

Why You‚Äôll Love It Here

üíô Global Benefits ‚Äì No matter where you are, you‚Äôll have access to:


Healthcare insurance ‚Äì so you can focus on what matters.
Wellness that works for you ‚Äì from gym memberships to mental health support, we‚Äôve got you covered.
Time off that counts ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a vacation, your birthday, or just a day to recharge, we believe in balance.
ESOP (Employee Share Ownership Plan) after 6 months with us‚Äîbecause we believe in sharing our success!


üìç Local Perks ‚Äì Depending on your location, you will be entitled to local benefits like meal vouchers (ticket restaurant), transport allowances, or extended parental leave.

üöÄ Career Growth ‚Äì We‚Äôre growing, and so can you! You‚Äôll find lots of chances to learn, develop, and explore new paths‚Äîwhether within your team or through cross-functional projects.

üåé A Truly Global Team ‚Äì Work with talented people from all over the world in a diverse and inclusive environment.

‚è≥ Flexibility That Works for You ‚Äì Remote work and flexible hours aren‚Äôt just buzzwords here. While the extent of flexibility depends on your role and team, we value results over rigid schedules. Prefer an office setting? You're welcome at any of our hubs in Barcelona, Warsaw, Curitiba, Rio de Janeiro, Mexico City, Bogot√°, Munich, Rome or Bologna.

Please note: At this time, we are not able to sponsor visas for this position. To apply, you must already have the legal right to work in your country of residence or the location of the role.

What We Believe In

At Docplanner, our values guide everything we do:

üìä Focus on results ‚Äì we're here to make an impact.

üß† Think like an owner ‚Äì take responsibility, drive outcomes.

‚úÇÔ∏è Keep it simple, keep it lean ‚Äì smart solutions over complexity.

üîä Be respectful and radically honest ‚Äì openness builds trust.

üìö Learn and be curious ‚Äì growth is part of the job.

Don‚Äôt just take our word for it‚Äîcheck out our Glassdoor to hear what our people say!

_________________________________________________________________________

We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We welcome applicants from all walks of life, regardless of gender, disability, or background, and are dedicated to fostering an inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and empowered to contribute.

You will be an integral part of the Financial Reporting team, working closely with the Data Analytics team to support business decisions based on data.

How would you be impacting our mission

  • Financial Reporting and Analysis: Track key financial metrics and KPIs, ensuring they align with organizational goals; Develop and maintain comprehensive financial dashboards using advanced BI tools; Provide detailed insights into financial performance, trends, and variances; Provide insights for long-term strategic decisions;
  • Data Management and Integration: Ensure accurate and timely collection of financial data from systems like Oracle NetSuite; Integrate data from multiple sources for a unified financial view;
  • Performance Measurement: Analyze profitability and cost efficiency to identify improvement areas;
  • Regulatory and Compliance Reporting: Support audits and for regulatory documentation;
  • Automation and Process Improvement: Automate repetitive financial tasks to improve efficiency; Implement process improvements to reduce manual efforts and errors;
  • Enhanced Reporting and Visualization: Utilize BI tools like Tableau for dynamic, interactive reports and dashboards; Enhance report quality and accessibility beyond traditional spreadsheets.

Qualifications

What will help you thrive?

  • Bachelor's degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
  • Demonstrable experience in using SQL to derive actionable insights, either in commercial or academic setting (must have).
  • Knowledge of Python/R and desire to expand your knowledge.
  • Experience with statistical modeling and descriptive statistics.
  • Experience in partnership with internal stakeholders.
  • Experience in leading and executing end to end BI projects.
  • Strong written and oral communication skills in English; proficiency in other languages such as German, Spanish, and Italian is a plus.
  • Ability to gather, organize, analyze, and report large volumes of financial data with speed and accuracy.
  • Strong attention to detail with the ability to provide high-quality work efficiently.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to adapt and work in a quickly changing environment, managing competing demands.

Which skills are ‚Äòbonus points‚Äô?

  • Master's degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
  • Able to take a step back from the technicalities and examine them through a business lens.
  • Open to cooperating with a lot of people from many teams in different countries.
  • Like to see the instant effects of your work.
  • Knowledge of ERP finance applications (Oracle, Oracle - NetSuite, SAP).
  • Relevant experience in accounting and financial reporting.

Additional Information

What to Expect from Our Hiring Process

Role

We like to keep things transparent and efficient! Here‚Äôs what the process usually looks like (though it might vary slightly depending on the role):

1Ô∏è‚É£ Intro Chat ‚Äì A first call with our Talent Acquisition Partner to explore mutual fit around relevant skills, value alignment, and motivation.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Hiring Manager Interview ‚Äì A deeper dive into your experience and aspirations with your future manager, who you‚Äôll be reporting to in this role. Take this chance to ask anything on your mind‚Äîit‚Äôs just as much about making sure we‚Äôre the right fit for you, too.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Second Hiring Manager Interview

4Ô∏è‚É£ Business Case Presentation & Team Meeting

Why You‚Äôll Love It Here

üíô Global Benefits ‚Äì No matter where you are, you‚Äôll have access to:

  • Healthcare insurance ‚Äì so you can focus on what matters.
  • Wellness that works for you ‚Äì from gym memberships to mental health support, we‚Äôve got you covered.
  • Time off that counts ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a vacation, your birthday, or just a day to recharge, we believe in balance.
  • ESOP (Employee Share Ownership Plan) after 6 months with us‚Äîbecause we believe in sharing our success!

üìç Local Perks ‚Äì Depending on your location, you will be entitled to local benefits like meal vouchers (ticket restaurant), transport allowances, or extended parental leave.

üöÄ Career Growth ‚Äì We‚Äôre growing, and so can you! You‚Äôll find lots of chances to learn, develop, and explore new paths‚Äîwhether within your team or through cross-functional projects.

üåé A Truly Global Team ‚Äì Work with talented people from all over the world in a diverse and inclusive environment.

‚è≥ Flexibility That Works for You ‚Äì Remote work and flexible hours aren‚Äôt just buzzwords here. While the extent of flexibility depends on your role and team, we value results over rigid schedules. Prefer an office setting? You're welcome at any of our hubs in Barcelona, Warsaw, Curitiba, Rio de Janeiro, Mexico City, Bogot√°, Munich, Rome or Bologna.

Please note: At this time, we are not able to sponsor visas for this position. To apply, you must already have the legal right to work in your country of residence or the location of the role.

What We Believe In

At Docplanner, our values guide everything we do:

üìä Focus on results ‚Äì we're here to make an impact.

üß† Think like an owner ‚Äì take responsibility, drive outcomes.

‚úÇÔ∏è Keep it simple, keep it lean ‚Äì smart solutions over complexity.

üîä Be respectful and radically honest ‚Äì openness builds trust.

üìö Learn and be curious ‚Äì growth is part of the job.

Don‚Äôt just take our word for it‚Äîcheck out our Glassdoor to hear what our people say!

_________________________________________________________________________

We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We welcome applicants from all walks of life, regardless of gender, disability, or background, and are dedicated to fostering an inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and empowered to contribute.

Title: Electronics & Data Analysis Internship
Description:
Are you an analytical person who enjoys Big Data analysis? Do you have an electronics background and want to grow in this area? HP Inc and be part of one of the most recognized supply chains in the industry!

We are the Procurement team for electromechanical parts within the Large Format Printing Business and 3D Business (aka LFP & 3D). We take care of direct materials procurement, and our deliverables are directly linked with the parts specifications, availability and suitability for all our needs.

PPSC is the acronym for the whole HP Procurement team and concerns the supply chain inbound.

Main Responsibilities


Support PPSC Large Format Printing and 3D EMECH team in the development of analysis tools to support Printed Circuit Assembly industrialization, design, and production.
Focus in the spend analytics, tracking and impact analysis for the various Manufacturer Partners.
Help the PPSC senior engineers with the different guidelines to be developed, maintained and communication WITH R&D and Operations Communities.
Be part of the PPSC electronics team, working closely to RD and operations to optimize Electronics design in terms of EE components selection, and cost analysis
Develop the data analysis layer for tracking Quality Data to improve industrialization activities, test coverage and faster TAT for corrective actions.


What are we looking for?


Fourth-year student, as well as master‚Äôs, currently enrolled in electronics or industrial engineering. Other related disciplines may be acceptable, depending on the technical knowledge. Academic agreement is required. Interest in Data Mining and Big Data would be a plus.
Tools needed: MS Office (PowerPoint, Excel, etc.), Power BI. Knowledge in coding would be a plus.
Strong data analytics and reporting skills: ability to analyze data and interpret it accurately to get conclusions.
Proactive, curious, and dynamic personality: Capacity and eagerness to learn quickly new tools, processes, methods, etc.
Autonomous and self-sufficient person: availability to work on your own and take risks on decisions and new solutions that need to be created.
Fluent in English.


Experience Our Benefits

Being part of HP means access to an international community with lots of growth opportunities within the company, professional development resources, networking opportunities, while enjoying in a great atmosphere making an impact.


You will be able to choose to either work office-based or hybrid work style.
Flexible schedule for part time (4h/day) or full time (8h/day) for a 3 to12 months agreement.
Lunch in the cafeteria.
Love sports? Then take advantage of our sports center (indoor and outdoor); gym, squash courts, tennis courts, basketball courts and with 25+ regular coordinated activities / sports , such as HIIT training, squash,‚ÄØbasketball and yoga.
A Young employee Network (YEN) which host fun events on a regular basis, such as ‚Äúbeer bust‚Äù Fridays at different venues including the beach in the summertime.
We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy and general health.
Free printing Happy hour ‚Äì from photographs to large posters. And Hands-on‚ÄØworkshops‚ÄØto print with the latest technology ‚Äì from wall covers to 3D printed models.


Sounds like you? Please apply and let‚Äôs talk!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About the Role

We're looking for an impact-driven Senior Data Analyst to join our team. This is a high-ownership role where you'll lead analytical initiatives end-to-end ‚Äî from framing problems to delivering insights and influencing decisions. You'll work across a range of areas, using your versatile skill set to solve problems that matter, and drive measurable impact on business performance.

This role is perfect for someone who thrives on variety, takes initiative, and wants to play a strategic role in shaping how analytics drives value across the business.

Key Responsibilities


Own high-impact analytics projects from scoping through to delivery, ensuring actionable insights, clear recommendations and implementation
Be the go-to expert for data-led decision-making.
Present findings to senior leadership and stakeholders with confidence, clarity, and business relevance.
Champion a culture of evidence-based decision-making, uplifting analytical capabilities across the org.
Develop, track, and evolve KPIs to monitor performance and highlight opportunities.
Use statistical or advanced analytical methods when appropriate to deepen understanding and guide strategy.
Take ownership of data quality, governance, and consistency in everything that you do.


Required Skills & Experience


5+ years of analytics or data experience, with a proven ability to drive impact through data.
Advanced SQL skills; fluency in Python or R is a plus.
Strong experience with data visualization platforms (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Demonstrated ability to own complex projects, work autonomously, and prioritize across multiple business needs.
Broad experience across domains (e.g. marketing analytics, product performance, financial modeling, customer insights).
Comfortable working with ambiguity and scoping problems independently.
Strong communication skills, with a track record of influencing decisions and telling compelling data stories.


Bonus Points


Experience in a fast paced environment.
Experience leading or mentoring other analysts or data professionals.
Understanding of statistical modelling and/or experimentation design.
Experience building and maintaining dashboards, self-serve tools, and reporting infrastructure that scale.


We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where we connect the dots for international property payments. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let's move the world of PropTech forward, together.

Redpin, Currencies Direct and TorFX are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, colour, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: BI Analyst Intern
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Global Reporting Team (GRT) at Criteo is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining a portfolio of performance reports across sales, business, and finance domains. As a BI Analyst Intern, you‚Äôll work in a fast-paced, data-driven environment where your contributions will directly impact decision-making across the company.

This internship offers a unique opportunity to deepen your technical skills while gaining exposure to a wide range of business functions. You‚Äôll collaborate with experienced analysts and stakeholders to deliver high-quality, automated reporting solutions.

As an intern, alongside the rest of the team, you will be responsible for :


Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and translate business needs into technical reporting requirements.
Design, build, and maintain dashboards and reports using SQL and BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Perform data validation, troubleshoot inconsistencies, and ensure data accuracy across reporting layers.
Automate recurring reporting processes using scripts or workflow tools.
Document processes, create user guides, and contribute to internal knowledge sharing.



Who You Are:


Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Business Analytics).
Strong analytical mindset with attention to detail and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Excellent communication skills in English (spoken and written).
Comfortable working independently and collaboratively in a dynamic environment.
Demonstrated interest in data, analytics, and technology.
Technical skills required: SQL (ability to write complex queries, perform joins, etc), Excel (pivot tables, vlookup, data manipulation), understanding of ETL processes and data modeling concepts.
Bonus skills: BI Tools (experience with Power BI, Tableau, or similar visualization platforms), familiarity with cloud data platforms, basic Python for data analysis or automation.
English speaking fluency, Russian is considered a plus (not mandatory)



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is a leader in commerce media, helping brands, agencies, and publishers create meaningful consumer connections through AI-powered advertising solutions. We‚Äôre shaping a more open and sustainable digital future for advertising.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices across the globe or from the comfort of home, our 3,600 Criteos collaborate together to build an open, impactful, and forward-thinking environment.

We foster a workplace where everyone is valued, and employment decisions are based solely on skills, qualifications, and business needs‚Äînever on non-job-related factors or legally protected characteristics.

What We Offer:

üè† Own your work style ‚Äì Build your work around your life and not the other way around.

üìà Grow with us ‚Äì Learning, mentorship & career development programs.

üí™ Your wellbeing matters ‚Äì Health benefits, wellness perks & mental health support.

ü§ù A team that cares ‚Äì Diverse, inclusive, and globally connected.

üí∏ Fair pay & perks ‚Äì Competitive salary, equity, performance-based rewards and family-friendly policies.

Additional benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo.
