Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Barcelona - Spain

Flexible working: 60% home office / week‚ÄØ

Job type: Permanent, Full time‚ÄØ - Hybrid

About The Job

At Sanofi, we're committed to providing next-gen healthcare through the power of data insights and AI. As a Data Engineer in our Manufacturing & Supply Digital Data Foundations team, you'll play a crucial role in transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive innovation and business value. You'll be part of an exciting journey to revolutionize our manufacturing processes through data-driven decision making.

We are an innovative global healthcare company with one purpose: to chase the miracles of science to improve people's lives. Our Digital Data & Technology organization is transforming Sanofi into an AI-driven powerhouse, creating trusted, high-quality data platforms that enable better decision-making across our global operations.

Main Responsibilities


Design and implement robust data engineering pipelines for Manufacturing & Supply systems, including SAP S4/HANA, QMS, LIMS, and MES
Create and maintain data integration solutions with comprehensive lifecycle management
Develop data visualization solutions using design-thinking approaches to deliver high-value products
Collaborate with cross-functional teams in agile pods to understand and translate business requirements
Ensure data quality and compliance with regulatory requirements (Data Privacy, GxP, SOX)
Build and optimize data models to support Manufacturing & Supply analytics needs


About You


Experience in data engineering and ETL/ELT development, particularly with Informatica/IICS and DBT/Airflow
Strong SQL skills and proficiency in Python for data transformation
Knowledge of data governance principles and quality assessment methodologies
Experience with cloud technologies, preferably AWS
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related field
Agile mindset with excellent communication and collaboration skills


Why choose us?


Drive innovation at the intersection of healthcare and technology
Develop your expertise with cutting-edge data and AI platforms
Enjoy a thoughtful rewards package that recognizes your contribution
Take advantage of flexible working arrangements and comprehensive health benefits
Work with global teams on transformative digital initiatives
Access continuous learning opportunities and career growth paths


nullPursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Join Sanofi and step into a new era of science - where your growth can be just as transformative as the work we do. We invest in you to reach further, think faster, and do what‚Äôs never-been-done-before. You‚Äôll help push boundaries, challenge convention, and build smarter solutions that reach the communities we serve. Ready to chase the miracles of science and improve people‚Äôs lives? Let‚Äôs Pursue Progress and Discover Extraordinary ‚Äì together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Kiwi.com

Kiwi.com is a leading global travel-tech company headquartered in the Czech Republic. Our innovative algorithm enables users to find better route options and prices other search engines can‚Äôt see, daily performing billions of price checks across 95% of global flight content. Are you bold, bright and curious? Join a global business that‚Äôs still got a start-up heart.

About Our Content Analytics Team

Our team is responsible for providing data-centric insights that enable the optimization of our flight content acquisition and processing. We use extensive datasets to support booking channel performance, improve autobooking efficiency and ensure data quality across our systems. Our work directly impacts Kiwi.com 's ability to offer our customers unique travel combinations and a smooth booking experience worldwide. We combine technical expertise with business understanding to build data-informed recommendations across multiple teams and stakeholders.

What You Will Do


You will conduct complex ad-hoc analysis using BigQuery and Looker, delivering insights that support thoughtful decision-making.
By creating and maintaining dashboards for key business metrics, you will help make data accessible and meaningful for stakeholders.
You will work with Looker's analytical layer, defining explores, measures and dimensions to support robust data exploration.
You will collaborate on building data models and support data quality through rigorous QA processes in collaboration with our data engineers.
You will evaluate and improve our complex flight booking and data acquisition systems, identifying opportunities for optimization.
You‚Äôll create data-informed recommendations by sharing practical insights with our flight content ecosystem.
You will help develop monitoring and alerting tools for product operations, enabling proactive incident detection and prevention.


What You Will Need


Your strong SQL skills and experience with BigQuery or similar data warehouses.
You have experience with BI tools (we use Looker) and a solid understanding of data modeling and data quality standards.
You can translate complex analytical findings into actionable insights that drive results.
You bring experience working with large datasets and collaborating with multiple stakeholders across teams.
Your excellent communication skills in English enable you to explain complex concepts to non-technical audiences.
You have an analytical mindset with a strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and precision in your work.
You are capable of working independently while aligning with and contributing to team goals.


We offer you


We offer a hybrid and flexible work environment. A lovely, modern office in the center of Barcelona (Passeig de Gracia) with great views and amenities.
Monthly entitlement of 200 Euro redeemable through Cobee. Cobee is a benefits platform offering a range of benefits (meals, transport, nursery, health insurance, and physical wellness) and flexible compensation. It also allows our employees to allocate up to 30% of their gross salary to the consumption of certain products or services, leveraging tax exemption.
We also enjoy benefits, such as flexible working hours, 30 paid vacation days and sick days.
Annual financial bonus based on company and individual performance.
Flight vouchers to celebrate your Kiwi anniversaries.
Relocation package (including visa transfer support).
Dogs are welcome in our offices.


Interested? Join us and help us make travel more accessible to all.

Kiwi.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, uniformed services, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Throughout the recruitment process and for some time after it‚Äôs finished, we‚Äôre going to process your Personal Data. You can find all the necessary information in our Privacy Policy available at: https://jobs.kiwi.com/recruitment-privacy-policy/ .

Alentando a los solicitantes con diferentes antecedentes, ideas y puntos de vista, creamos equipos que trabajan 
juntos para resolver problemas complejos y dise√±ar soluciones pr√°cticas para nuestros clientes. Nuestras m√∫ltiples 
perspectivas provienen de muchas fuentes, incluida la diversidad √©tnica, cultura, g√©nero, nacionalidad, edad, 
sexo, orientaci√≥n sexual, identidad y expresi√≥n de g√©nero, discapacidad, estado civil, estado parental, educaci√≥n, 
antecedentes sociales y experiencia de vida de nuestra gente.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Smadex is a leading advertising technology company founded in Barcelona in 2011 and sold to American-based and stock-listed Entravision in 2018 (NYSE::EVC). We are a fully transparent platform built with top technology, countless programmatic management features and powerful machine learning algorithms to help advertisers grow their business at scale. We are currently considered one of the top mobile ad-tech companies in the world.

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to work closely with the ML and Product teams. The candidate should be communicative and analytical, in order to answer the complex questions that Product and Campaign performance are facing. For this purpose we use tons of data available to get powerful insights to resolve them, creating effective strategies to help improve the Smadex platform!¬†

This is a full-time position based in Barcelona.

Your tasks and responsibilities:

Analyze large, complex data sets containing the behaviour of millions of mobile users and Apps worldwide to influence Product & ML strategies.¬†
Working cross-functionally with business and technical teams to support product performance.
Develop dashboards and processes to ensure data influences decisions at all levels of the company.

Skills and requirements:

3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst / Data Scientist.
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in a Quantitative Field (Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science).
Strong problem-solving skills, ability to formulate questions, run analysis to articulate a recommendation.
Proven working knowledge of Python, SQL and large data sets, understanding of analytic methodologies for data evaluation.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present analysis and conclusions.
Strong knowledge and experience of statistical concepts and hypothesis testing.
Knowledge of the ad-tech industry is a plus.

Please note that we do NOT provide VISA sponsorship. Candidates without a legal permit to work in Spain won't be considered.

What is in it for you:

Integrate a highly motivated, young and dynamic team
Great compensation package
Top location at the heart of Barcelona with a rooftop terrace, Barbecue, and a fully stocked fridge
Great work-life balance: work from home (2 days per week), flexible hours
LinkedIn Learning and training opportunities
Meal vouchers - Ticket Restaurant monthly allowance
Monthly gym allowance to use in up to 30 DIR gyms around the city
Monthly TGIF events
Regular team-building events
Fun and friendly work environment with talented marketers and engineers from over 28 countries
And more!

Title: Digital Data Expert
Description:
At ING we are looking for Digital Data Expert







Your role and work environment:




We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Digital Data Expert to join our Data Oversight Delivery Area Team of Data Management Tribe Spain.




The responsibility of this team is to ensure delivery and compliance with regulatory reporting obligations and global initiatives, delivering high quality developments based on Agile Methodology. Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead‚Äîthat‚Äôs our DNA.







Your key responsibilities:




As a Digital Data Expert in Regulatory Data you will:




As a key member of a squad, you will provide a broad knowledge on ING products, services, channels, and Regulatory Reporting.

You are part of the delivery team to define functional requirements, participation in testing and support before the Go-live.

You control the process of Regulatory and Global reporting, solve the incidents in case of errors, provide the information and help to the support teams or the providers.

You identify the products or services that best meet the customer's stated needs, use personal expertise to propose quantities and product configurations. You represent the voice of the internal customer improving the processes.

You are responsible for improving the service with an end-to-end mindset, for the day-to-day performance, for building reliable business operations and services, and for connecting it with internal or external parties.




You work with Risk, Compliance, and Legal stakeholders, to make sure our products and services comply with regulation and policies.




What are we looking for?




Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt hesitate to apply!

Master or bachelor‚Äôs degree between 3/6 years of experience managing complex projects.
Be able to translate customer feedback into improvements of our digital journeys.
IT affinity: understand how the customer journeys connect to the underlying IT landscape, incl. the technical dependencies on components owned by other Tribes; and communicate with, and where necessary challenge, the IT developers and architects.
Strong effective presentations skills.
Excellent communication skills. Ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences.
Fluency in English and Spanish is required.
Remote Collaboration: be adept at collaborating with team members in different time zones and cultural backgrounds.
Cross-Cultural Sensitivity & Empathy: Being aware of cultural differences within the offshore team fosters a positive and harmonious work environment.
Adaptability: be flexible and adaptable to changing circumstances and time zone differences.
Prioritization: Strong prioritization skills and ensure the team focuses on delivering high-impact results.
Risk Management: Identifying potential risks in an offshore setup and implementing measures to mitigate them ensures smoother project execution.
Deadlines Management: Efficiently managing time and deadlines to keep the development on track and deliver the product within scheduled timelines.
Stakeholder Management: Engaging and managing stakeholders effectively for successful project outcomes.
Problem-Solving: Strong problem-solving skills enable to address challenges and obstacles that may arise




What do we offer?




The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but‚Ä¶ What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.




Check out what is waiting for you!




Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.

Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn‚Äôt take up your time or your cravings.

Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!

Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).




Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.

Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids‚Ä¶

Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.

Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!

More vitality and more belonging

360¬∫ care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Physiotherapy service on site.

Runners club with your own trainer.

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Gympass service.

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+) & Leonas.







Get to know Us




We are a team of more than 1600 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.




A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.




And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.




We are proud to have a diverse team and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.




And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clients decide to embark on this journey.




Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead‚Äîthat‚Äôs our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working‚Ä¶we are looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Data Analyst with Tableau and SQL (Hybrid - Madrid)
Description:
üöÄ We are still looking for the very Top Talent‚Ä¶and we would be delighted if you were to join our team!

More in details, UST is a multinational company based in North America, certified as a Top Employer and Great Place to Work company with over 35.000 employees all over the world and presence in more than 35 countries. We are leaders on digital technology services, and we provide large-scale technologic solutions to big companies.




üîé What we look for?

We are looking for a Data Business Analyst with at least 3 years of experience to join the Data Visualization Competence Center with Tableau and SQL skills to support the transition to a new data platform of our client from the banking sector.




High english level is required.




Availability to go to the client's offices in the centre of Madrid 3 days a week.




‚öô Key Responsibilities:

Analyse the current BI landscape, understand business needs, and identify gaps between the legacy and future data environments.
Read, interpret, troubleshoot, and eventually build or enhance Tableau reports, and work hands-on with SQL to validate and explore data as part of your analysis..
Building dashboards.




üí° Mandatory requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field such as Data Analytics, Computer Science, Business Intelligence, or related discipline 3+ years in a data/BI/business analyst or similar role
Solid hands-on experience with Tableau and SQL
Ability to conduct gap analysis and map current vs future state in data/reporting environments
Skilled in creating clear, structured documentation
Ability to understand and communicate data/reporting-related changes and its business impact
Ability to translate technical findings into clear, business-friendly insights Data analysis and problem solving skills
Exceptional communication skills to interact with both technical teams and business stakeholders.
Detail-oriented mindset with the ability to manage multiples tasks and prioritize effectively
Proactive, collaborative, and customer-focused approach to solving problems
English at least B2+/C1




üí∞ ¬øWhat can we offer?

-‚úàÔ∏è 23 days of Annual Leave plus the 24th and 31st of December as discretionary days!

-‚ù§Ô∏è Numerous benefits (Heath Care Plan, Internet Connectivity, Life and Accident Insurances).

-üç¥ `Retribuci√≥n Flexible¬¥ Program: (Meals, Kinder Garden, Transport, online English lessons, Heath Care Plan‚Ä¶)

-üéì Free access to several training platforms

-üöÄ Professional stability and career plans

-üö∂ UST also, compensates referrals from which you could benefit when you refer professionals.

-üîó The option to pick between 12 or 14 payments along the year.

-üè° Real Work Life Balance measures (flexibility, WFH or remote work policy, compacted hours during summertime‚Ä¶)

-üéÅ UST Club Platform discounts and gym Access discounts




üìß If you would like to know more, do not hesitate to apply and we‚Äôll get in touch to fill you in details. UST is waiting for you!

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
At Bloq.it, we‚Äôve created the world‚Äôs leading smart locker solution. Solving online deliveries by enabling everyone to participate easily, reducing delivery costs and making them more sustainable.

We‚Äôre quickly expanding, and after growing at 1000% for three years in a row, we‚Äôre now the fastest-growing Smart Locker company in the world and one of the fastest growing scale-ups in Europe.

We are in search of a Data Analyst to join our innovative team as our new #bloqstar. In this role, you'll play a crucial role in designing and maintaining dashboards, responding to ad-hoc data requests, and collaborating with colleagues to continually elevate Bloq.it‚Äôs support processes.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

  • Build real-time and periodic reporting tools to track ticket volumes, SLA adherence, and operational KPIs;
  • Investigate spikes in issues, unusual trends, or client-specific concerns and produce clear, concise findings;
  • Collaborate with the Tooling Specialist to ensure accurate data flow from various systems;
  • Present actionable recommendations to the Intelligence Team Lead and other stakeholders;
  • Prepare periodic business review reports and performance summaries for customers, highlighting key insights and recommendations.

What You‚Äôll Bring To The Table

  • Experience with BI platforms (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker) and data manipulation (SQL, Python, etc.);
  • Ability to dissect complex data sets and identify root causes behind trends;
  • Capable of explaining technical findings to both technical and non-technical audiences;
  • Comfortable working cross-functionally with support managers, tool specialists, and engineering teams;
  • Fluency in English and Portuguese (written and spoken).

Why join us?

The opportunity to join our Operations team and play a pivotal role in analyzing and optimizing support data to enhance efficiency, improve processes, and drive strategic decision-making while contributing to innovative solutions that redefine Bloq.it's revolution in the smart locker industry ;

A dynamic and fast-paced work environment with a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning ;

Competitive salary and flexible benefits package, tailored to your experience and skills ;

Eligibility for performance-based bonus, tied to your results and designed to reward your impact ;

Work how you work best - we offer a remote-friendly policy and flexible hours so you can stay productive and keep life balanced ;

Portuguese Health Insurance ;

Unlimited days off (subject to manager approval).

Ready to join the revolution?

At Bloq.it, we provide end-to-end solutions for Smart Lockers, and our software ecosystem, Bloq.it OS, is the leading tech solution available in the market.

We've had the pleasure of working with some of the biggest names in e-commerce, logistics, and retail in Europe, such as Vinted and DHL.

We have recently become the fastest-growing Smart Locker company in the world. Before Bloq.it the industry had stagnated and lacked innovation and good products. We strive to have the same impact in this industry as Tesla has had on the car industry.

We believe that Smart Lockers are a big part of the future for everyone, and we want to play our part in making sure that Smart Lockers become as mainstream as the mobile phone.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
At Bloq.it, we‚Äôve created the world‚Äôs leading smart locker solution. Solving online deliveries by enabling everyone to participate easily, reducing delivery costs and making them more sustainable.

We‚Äôre quickly expanding, and after growing at 1000% for three years in a row, we‚Äôre now the fastest-growing Smart Locker company in the world and one of the fastest growing scale-ups in Europe.

We are in search of a Data Analyst to join our innovative team as our new #bloqstar.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to gather business requirements and deliver data-driven solutions aligned with organizational objectives;
  • Work closely with data engineers and business teams to address data challenges and provide recommendations based on analysis;
  • Extract, transform, and analyze data from Amazon Redshift, AWS S3 Data Lakes, and MongoDB Atlas, ensuring data accuracy and integrity;
  • Create insightful dashboards and reports using visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or AWS QuickSight to present actionable insights;
  • Tackle business ad-hoc requests by exploring data product solutions or retrieving data directly from golden sources to address immediate needs.

What You‚Äôll Bring To The Table

  • Minimum of 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role;
  • Proficiency in SQL for querying and Python or R for data analysis and scripting;
  • Experience in data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or AWS QuickSight;
  • Strong communication skills to present insights clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.

It Would Be Great If You Would Also Have

  • Knowledge of statistical modeling or machine learning techniques is a plus;
  • Familiarity with MongoDB Atlas, including querying NoSQL data.

Why join us?

  • The opportunity to join our Software team and play a pivotal role in contributing to innovative solutions that redefine Bloq.it's revolution in the smart locker industry ;
  • A dynamic and fast-paced work environment with a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning;
  • Competitive salary and flexible benefits package, tailored to your experience and skills ;
  • Eligibility for performance-based bonus, tied to your results and designed to reward your impact ;
  • Work how you work best - we offer a remote-friendly policy and flexible hours so you can stay productive and keep life balanced ;
  • Portuguese Health Insurance ;
  • Unlimited days off (subject to manager approval).

Ready to join the revolution?

At Bloq.it, we provide end-to-end solutions for Smart Lockers, and our software ecosystem, Bloq.it OS, is the leading tech solution available in the market.

We've had the pleasure of working with some of the biggest names in e-commerce, logistics, and retail in Europe, such as Vinted and DHL.

We believe that Smart Lockers are a big part of the future for everyone, and we want to play our part in making sure that Smart Lockers become as mainstream as the mobile phone.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Finsolutia intends to reinforce its Information Technology (IT) team with a Data Analyst (M/F).

We are looking for talented and self-motivated individuals for a broad and interesting role working as part of a team based in Lisbon.

Responsibilities


Design and develop Microsoft Power BI reports and Dashboards (Operational, Strategic & Analytical) including data set ingestion and transformation, Data Modeling, Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) using the appropriate report templates depicting status of key performance indicators (KPIs) and other important business metrics for an organization to make data driven decisions
Work with cross-functional teams to gather and document reporting requirements to meet business needs
Build data models, technical and functional documentation with business partners
Review and interpret ongoing business report requirements;
Writing optimized SQL queries for integration with other applications
Designing database tables and related objects;
Transition developed reports and dashboards to interactive/automated dashboards using Power BI
Use T-SQL to develop and implement procedures and functions;
Provide support as required to ensure the availability and optimal performance of developed reports and dashboards for both external and internal users
Design and implement technology best practices, guidelines and repeatable processes
Extract and analyze data using PowerQuery, PivotTables, MS Excel, Power BI and DAX.
Design, develop, update, and optimize Power BI dashboards, reports and scorecards to meet business requirements.


Hard Skills


Understanding of T-SQL programming (Microsoft SQL Server)
Knowledge of Databricks PySpark / SparkSQL
Knowledge of data modeling following the best practices
2+ years of experience in creating reports, dashboards using Power BI Desktop and Server and maintaining Power BI dashboards on servers.
Understanding of tuning of Power BI reports, data sets, and SQL to deliver maximum report performance.
Experience with ETL Processes Experience with Python and C# (nice to have)
Fluent in English


Soft Skills


Proactivity and constant technological evolution;
Team work and result oriented;
Good communication and interpersonal / facilitation skills.


We‚Äôd like to inform you that personal data collected here are exclusively destined to the management of the recruitment process in question and will be processed and storage by Finsolutia, SA, or another Group company, in accordance with Personal Data Protection Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of 27 April 2016 during a period of 5 years, after which they will be definitively eliminated.

We Further Inform You That The Holder Will Have Free Access To Its Personal Data, And May Request Its Updating, Rectification Or Removal By Simply Sending The Request In Writing To

Bernardo Cabral

Data Protection Officer

dpo@finsolutia.com

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Qualitest Group is looking for a talented Data Analyst!

Qualitest, the largest quality assurance company in the world, is recruiting for a Data Quality project in partnership with one of the world‚Äôs largest tech providers.

If you are a passionate tech savvy person, with analytical, problem-solving, communication, organizational, and time management skills, you‚Äôre the one we‚Äôre looking for!

Responsibilities

  • Data Validation and Cleansing: Conduct regular checks to validate the accuracy and completeness of data.
  • Quality Control Framework Development: Develop and implement data quality standards, policies, and procedures.
  • Root Cause Analysis: Investigate the underlying causes of data quality issues.
  • Work with data engineers and other stakeholders to implement permanent solutions and prevent recurrence of these problems.
  • Data Governance Collaboration: Collaborate with data governance teams to ensure compliance with company policies and regulations.
  • Assist in defining data ownership and stewardship to promote accountability.
  • Process Improvement: Proactively identify opportunities to improve data collection, storage, and processing workflows.
  • Suggest and implement changes to enhance data quality and streamline data management processes.
  • Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data quality processes, business rules, and quality assurance processes. This ensures that everyone understands the data and how it should be used.

Skills

  • Detail-oriented, organized, and able to work on multiple projects over the course of a day;
  • Proficiency (C1) in English;
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently;
  • Excellent analytical skills, logical problem solving skills;
  • Creative, out-of-the-box thinking;
  • Experience troubleshooting complex problems;
  • Meticulously high level of attention to detail and accurate documentation of information;
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication and listening skills;
  • High level of cultural sensitivity and awareness to work effectively with diverse teams.

Ready to make a difference? Join the Qualitest Team!

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


Within CIB, the Transaction Banking business concerns two fundamental business lines:
Cash Management (all products that assist our customers with their liquidity needs, i.e. current accounts, term deposits, payments & collections, forex, etc.)
Global Trade Solutions (all products that assist our customers with their global trade needs, i.e. letters of credit, guarantees, supply chain management, factoring, etc.)
We are looking for a Senior Business Intelligence Data Analyst to join the Transaction Banking COO Office team to be responsible for the Global Trade Solutions & Supply Chain Management business line
Reporting to the Head of Transaction Banking COO Office in Portugal, you will be in charge of generating and maintaining all the necessary business monitoring reports for this perimeter, working on the full end-to-end process from data extraction, data preparation ,data cleaning, data engineering, all to the way to data visualization. In addition the role will require a sharp eye and keen attention to detail as you will handle and manipulate large volumes of data coming from multiple sources, as well as provide support on a few regulatory fronts
This role requires a deep understanding of data analysis techniques, strong analytical skills, and the ability to communicate findings effectively to Senior Management. You will work in close proximity with our risk and GTS colleagus in Paris and with different GTS & SCM counterparties in AMER and APAC countries

Your Main Activities Are


Maintain and enrich our existing Global asset report with the goal of simplifying end user experience and extract key insights at first glance
Prepare all necessary data and generate the visuals to launch a new report covering the Supply Chain Management scope
From a risk standpoint, construct a new report to allow a view on the obligors of our Supply Chain Management clients
Collect, clean, and analyze large data sets from various operational sources to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Conduct reconciliation exercises on data coming from multiple sources to make sure that figures are consistent and aligned.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by implementing data quality checks and validation processes.
Identify opportunities for process improvements and recommend data-driven solutions
Collaborate with Transaction Banking COO and Transaction Banking department Heads who request business analysis
Contribute to the development and governance of our data and support the different business lines with data-driven decision-making


Profile And Skills To Success


Master¬¥s Degree in Computer Science / Information Technology / Information Management
At least 3 years of experience handling large data sets and dealing with ETL processes
Fluent in English (mandatory)
Highly proficient with MS Excel
Experience with Power BI
Proficiency in analytics and data management


About The Team


As Global TB COO team we assist our different business teams in multiple topics, both on daily/monthly needs as in project mode. We have a small team of data analysts/scientists focusing on data who are involved in the conception of data use cases from exploration phase up to production delivery


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Location

Hybrid in Lisbon (minimum of 2-3 days a week from the office)

SHAPE THE FUTURE OF PRIVACY WITH USERCENTRICS

Usercentrics is a global leader in data privacy and privacy-led marketing solutions. We believe there is no need for a trade-off between growth and privacy compliance. Our vision is to unlock the potential of data privacy to empower a thriving digital ecosystem. We work with companies to create a healthy balance between data-driven business and privacy-led marketing for every size of enterprise. Our customers build trust with their users through improved transparency and control to drastically improve marketing and monetization, while achieving full privacy compliance.

We‚Äôre looking for a Product Data Analyst who thrives at the intersection of data, product

strategy, and business impact. In this role, you‚Äôll act as a bridge between data and product

teams , helping drive better decision-making through insight, instrumentation, and strong

stakeholder collaboration.

Your Tasks


Partner with Product Managers, Designers, and Engineers to identify key metrics and turn product data into actionable insights
Act as the PM for data-related initiatives that support the product organization(dashboards, tracking plans, user behavior models, etc.)
Own the instrumentation strategy for product features, ensuring accurate and scalable tracking using tools like Amplitude
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand needs, prioritize requests, and translate them into data products and solutions
Build and maintain dashboards and reports (Power BI or similar) to support decision-making
Communicate complex findings in a clear, business-friendly way to non-technical stakeholders
Support experimentation frameworks and help define success metrics
Ensure data quality and consistency across platforms and teams


You Bring


Solid business acumen and a strong understanding of product development lifecycle
Hands-on experience with product analytics tools (Amplitude required, Mixpanel or similar a plus)
Intermediate SQL skills, able to write clean, optimized queries
Experience with Power BI or similar BI tools (Looker, Tableau, etc.)
Excellent communication skills, you can explain data to non-data people with clarity and confidence
A proactive, collaborative mindset, you're comfortable prioritizing, managing stakeholders, and acting as the ‚Äúgo-to‚Äù person for product data
Experience working closely with Product, Design, or Engineering teams


NICE TO HAVE


Familiarity with event tracking plans, instrumentation workflows, or CDPs
Experience working in SaaS, B2B, or product-led growth environments
Exposure to A/B testing, growth analytics, or behavioral segmentation


Don‚Äôt meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of colour are

less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Usercentrics we are

dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you‚Äôre excited about this

role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job

description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or

other roles.

Why join Usercentrics?


Joining Usercentrics means becoming part of a fast-growing, diverse and international team of tech enthusiasts and entrepreneurially-minded who build our success story together
Company culture is important to us - we strive to continuously develop a positive, vibrant and inspiring environment that enables everyone to thrive both personally and professionally
Get involved! We have plenty of initiatives and love to see people from all department enthusiastically participating and shaping our future together in different cross-department projects
Your work-life balance is important to us too - we offer flexible working hours, hybrid working and the possibility of workcations (in accordance with our company policy)
We always remember to have fun along the way, both in our day-to-day work and at our regular team events on site in our offices in Munich, Copenhagen, Odense, Lisbon and Prague or online
You are the most valuable asset to our company which is why we‚Äôre happy to offer awesome benefits like our personal development budget, job-related language courses and a lot more (depending on your location) to focus on your well being


About Us

We are driven by our values #BeBrave, #BetterTogether, #LeadbyExample, #InnovateWithPurpose, #PassionForPrivacy, #GiveBack and #ComeAsYouAre. They show what we believe in and how we work. They help make our team special and guide us in everything we do. They're the heart of our company and inspire us to do our best every day.

We strive to create a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment (DEI) where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to reach their full potential. We believe that our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are our greatest strengths ‚Äî so we are committed to building with them as we foster innovation and drive our success.

We recognize that this is an ongoing journey. We commit to listening and to continuous learning, growth, and improvement. By embracing DEI principles, we will create a more just and equitable society, and we are proud to play our part in making this vision a reality.

We are #BetterTogether.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
P2P.org is the largest institutional staking provider with a TVL of over $10B and a market share exceeding 20% in restaking.

We are continually focused on researching and improving our infrastructure to extract maximum APR while enhancing security. For instance, in ETH and SOL, our NRR is on average 10% higher than the market, and in DOT, it's 20% higher.

We also place significant focus and resources on launching new networks such as TON, Avail, Monad, Babylon, Story, Berachain, and others, along with yield products. From restaking, where we are the largest operator with a 20+% market share, to yield aggregators on stablecoins.

Our clients include BitGo, Copper, Crypto.com, Ledger, ByBit, Bitget, OKX, HTX, Bitvavo, SBI, and others, who choose us for our client-centric approach and extensive product line from unified API to widgets and custom dApps.

We are also actively expanding our product line, exploring RWA, data, yield, and service products for banks, exchanges, custodians, and wallets.

P2P.org unites talented individuals globally ‚ù§Ô∏è

Despite our distributed team, we share a passion for decentralized finance - a fairer system for all. We code, learn, create, and connect to shape finance's future üí∞

P2P.org boasts a strong reputation and network. We prioritize customer satisfaction and, as tech enthusiasts, develop innovative solutions that bolster our brand.

You will


Analyze large, complex datasets (on-chain and off-chain) to derive strategic and product insights
Develop models and dashboards to monitor validator performance, user behavior, and protocol performance
Investigate network economics, user incentives, and staking flows to support growth strategies, research new revenue opportunities
Conduct exploratory and root-cause analysis of ecosystem or performance changes
Build data tools and reporting frameworks to scale internal decision-making
Present insights and data stories clearly to technical and non-technical audiences


You have


5+ years of experience in data analysis, strategy, or research roles in tech, fintech, or crypto
Proficiency in advanced SQL and Python (must be comfortable working with large, complex datasets)
Strong business acumen and problem-solving skills ‚Äì ability to work from ambiguous problem statements to clear recommendations
Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English)
Experience with data visualization tools like Superset, Metabase, Looker, or Tableau
Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or related field


Nice to have


Prior work in Web3, or an active interest in the crypto space
Experience with blockchain data platforms: Dune Analytics, The Graph, Flipside, etc.
Exposure to staking protocols, validator infrastructure, or DeFi analytics
Experience of building data pipelines with tools like dbt, Airflow etc.


At P2P.org we have a team of experts with their own unique approach and ownership culture. Together we gain experience and make dreams come true! üåü


Full-time Contractor (Indefinite-term Consultancy Agreement)
Competitive salary level in $ (we can also pay in Crypto)
Well-being program
Mental Health care program
Compensation for education, including Foreign Language & professional growth courses
Equipment & co-working reimbursement program
Overseas conferences, community immersion
Positive and friendly communication culture


P2P.org is committed to providing equal opportunities. All applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability.


Show more

Title: Data Curator
Description:
Shape the future of innovation, startups & economies

Dealroom is the world‚Äôs startup and venture capital database, used by leading teams like Accel, Index, Atomico, Google, Microsoft, AWS, SAP, and 100+ governments, to discover the world‚Äôs next generation of transformative companies.

We‚Äôre on a mission to accelerate innovation by empowering decision-makers with the most comprehensive data on startups, scaleups, and ecosystems.

Joining Dealroom means working at the confluence of AI, big data, and venture capital and acting as a catalyst at the heart of startup ecosystems. We value relentless client focus, transparency, openness, and candour - the freedom to take risks, admit failures, and speak openly.

About The Data Curation Team

Join our team of data analysts and content curators to improve the quality and accuracy of our data, and to elevate the experience of our users. This role is ideal for team players and problem solvers with an investigative mind looking to enter the world of startups and venture capital. You will develop skills in data quality and classification while expanding your technical toolkit and co-creating scalable solutions. You'll often work directly with our clients.

As a Data Curator, you‚Äôll


Ensure data quality through curation, desk research, classification, content review, and moderation.
Support data operations workflows and assist engineering teams.
Monitor and improve data quality metrics.
Contribute to developing scalable data management solutions.


What You Bring


Academic Credentials: A completed Bachelor's degree in (Business) Information Technology, Finance, Economics, Content Management, or related fields.
Interests: Data and data management tools, from GenAI to Python and BigQuery.
Passion: A demonstrated enthusiasm for technology, startups, and venture capital markets.
Mindset: A proactive, accountable, and urgent approach to work.
Adaptability: Comfort in a fast-paced startup environment where continuous learning, OKRs, ongoing feedback, and curiosity drive success.
Eligibility: Eligibility to work in the EU, residency in the Lisbon area, and fluency in English. Additional language skills are welkom / wilkommen / bienvenido / kyaosopartaal.


What We Bring To The Deal


Ownership: A role where you truly own your work. Show us your capabilities, and we‚Äôll support your growth.
Comprehensive Benefits: Enjoy benefits like a laptop of your choice, flexible hours, a fully equipped home office setup, travel allowances, a development budget, weekly workout sessions, and more.
Global & Inclusive Culture: Join a diverse team spanning over 25 nationalities.
Vibrant Workplace: Work in a dynamic environment in the heart of Lisbon (Baixa-Chiado) with flexible hybrid options.
Meritocratic Environment: We value entrepreneurial thinking and are committed to turning innovative ideas into reality.


Ready to accelerate the future of innovation with us? Share your story, and let‚Äôs create something transformative together.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (Growth & Marketing)
Description:
üìö TripleTen is a U.S.-based tech school internationally recognized for its excellence in education and transformative impact. We‚Äôre rapidly expanding in Brazil, helping more and more people break into the tech industry‚Äîregardless of where they‚Äôre starting from. We value talent, promote continuous learning, and offer real challenges that drive both personal and professional growth in a global and innovative environment.

We're looking for passionate analyst to help the team set up experiments and validate growth and marketing hypothesis in a fast-paces growth team in Brazil EdTech market.

What you will do:

Growth:


Identify growth opportunities through data analysis
Monitor conversion funnels from impression to enrollment completion
Execute A/B testing and analyze marketing experiments
Track qualified lead generation metrics (MQLs and SQLs)
Analyze user behavior and build end-to-end reporting to track it
Map customer journey and identify optimization opportunities


Marketing:


Conduct cohort analysis for different marketing segments
Analyze performance across channels (Google Ads, Facebook Ads, LinkedIn, SEO, email marketing)
Create attribution models to understand channel impact
Help marketing and sales departments to sync by clarifying pyramid of metrics
Support remarketing and nurturing strategies with data-driven insights
Create visualizations for ROI, ROAS, CAC (Customer Acquisition Cost), and LTV (Lifetime Value)
Present actionable insights for budget and strategy optimization
Develop and maintain daily marketing campaign dashboards using Tableau


Requirements:


3+ years of experience in Data Analytics, specifically in Marketing, Growth or Product fields
Advanced English
Expertise in Tableau (dashboard creation, calculated fields, parameters, actions)
Proficiency in SQL or Python for marketing data extraction and manipulation
Familiarity with marketing automation tools (RD Station, HubSpot or Salesforce)
Knowledge of digital campaign analysis and performance metrics


What we can offer you:


100% remote work, with flexibility and work-life balance
Paid time off (vacation and national holidays)
Opportunity to make a real, direct impact on the company's results by actively contributing to our growth
A diverse, global team with people based in the U.S., Latin America, Brazil, Serbia, Georgia, and more than 10 other countries

Title: Business Data Analyst ‚Äì Commercial
Description:
Location

Hybrid in Lisbon (minimum of 2 days a week from the office)

SHAPE THE FUTURE OF PRIVACY WITH USERCENTRICS

Usercentrics is a global leader in data privacy and privacy-led marketing solutions. We believe there is no need for a trade-off between growth and privacy compliance. Our vision is to unlock the potential of data privacy to empower a thriving digital ecosystem. We work with companies to create a healthy balance between data-driven business and privacy-led marketing for every size of enterprise. Our customers build trust with their users through improved transparency and control to drastically improve marketing and monetization, while achieving full privacy compliance.

We are seeking a highly skilled Business Data Analyst to join our BI Team, with a dedicated focus on supporting the Commercial Team. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis, funnel analysis, and commercial performance metrics to deliver actionable insights that drive revenue growth and sales efficiency. You will act as a bridge between data analysis and commercial strategy, enabling data-driven decisions and optimizing commercial operations.

Your Tasks


Act as a dedicated BI partner to the Commercial Team, providing insights to improve sales performance, pipeline management, and revenue generation.
Conduct funnel analysis to understand and optimize the sales process, identifying bottlenecks and areas for improvement.
Analyze sales data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement in sales operations and strategies.
Monitor and report on key sales performance metrics, including pipeline health, win rates, deal velocity, average deal size, etc
Design, develop, and maintain dashboards in Power BI, providing stakeholders with visibility into sales performance and funnel progression.
Use SQL to query and manipulate data from various sources, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Collaborate with commercial leaders to identify opportunities for improvement and provide actionable recommendations based on data insights.
Support forecasting efforts by analyzing historical data and trends, enabling accurate revenue projections.
Stay updated on sales trends, tools, and best practices to continuously enhance reporting and analysis.


You Bring


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Data Analytics, Marketing, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, with a focus on B2B SaaS GTM performance and funnel analysis.
Intermediate skills in SQL for querying and analyzing data.
Expertise in Power BI (or similar tools) for creating dashboards, visualizations, and reports.
Strong understanding of sales metrics and KPIs, such as Customer Lifetime Value (CLV), Lead Conversion Rates, and Sales Cycle Length.
Proven experience in conducting and interpreting funnel analysis to optimize sales processes.
Exceptional communication skills to present insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong business acumen with the ability to translate data into actionable recommendations for the sales team.
Experience collaborating with V- and C-level stakeholders, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives.
Growth mindset and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
High degree of proactivity and self-sufficiency, capable of identifying opportunities and driving insights independently


Why join Usercentrics?


Joining Usercentrics means becoming part of a fast-growing, diverse and international team of tech enthusiasts and entrepreneurially-minded who build our success story together
Company culture is important to us - we strive to continuously develop a positive, vibrant and inspiring environment that enables everyone to thrive both personally and professionally
Get involved! We have plenty of initiatives and love to see people from all department enthusiastically participating and shaping our future together in different cross-department projects
Your work-life balance is important to us too - we offer flexible working hours, hybrid working and the possibility of workcations (in accordance with our company policy)
We always remember to have fun along the way, both in our day-to-day work and at our regular team events on site in our offices in Munich, Copenhagen, Odense, Lisbon and Prague or online
You are the most valuable asset to our company which is why we‚Äôre happy to offer awesome benefits like our personal development budget, job-related language courses and a lot more (depending on your location) to focus on your well being


About Us

We are driven by our values #BeBrave, #BetterTogether, #LeadbyExample, #InnovateWithPurpose, #PassionForPrivacy, #GiveBack and #ComeAsYouAre. They show what we believe in and how we work. They help make our team special and guide us in everything we do. They're the heart of our company and inspire us to do our best every day.

We strive to create a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment (DEI) where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to reach their full potential. We believe that our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are our greatest strengths ‚Äî so we are committed to building with them as we foster innovation and drive our success.

We recognize that this is an ongoing journey. We commit to listening and to continuous learning, growth, and improvement. By embracing DEI principles, we will create a more just and equitable society, and we are proud to play our part in making this vision a reality.

We are #BetterTogether.

  • Strong understanding of sales metrics and KPIs, such as Customer Lifetime Value (CLV), Lead Conversion Rates, and Sales Cycle Length.
  • Proven experience in conducting and interpreting funnel analysis to optimize sales processes.
  • Exceptional communication skills to present insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Strong business acumen with the ability to translate data into actionable recommendations for the sales team.
  • Experience collaborating with V- and C-level stakeholders, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives.
  • Growth mindset and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
  • High degree of proactivity and self-sufficiency, capable of identifying opportunities and driving insights independently

Why join Usercentrics?

  • Joining Usercentrics means becoming part of a fast-growing, diverse and international team of tech enthusiasts and entrepreneurially-minded who build our success story together
  • Company culture is important to us - we strive to continuously develop a positive, vibrant and inspiring environment that enables everyone to thrive both personally and professionally
  • Get involved! We have plenty of initiatives and love to see people from all department enthusiastically participating and shaping our future together in different cross-department projects
  • Your work-life balance is important to us too - we offer flexible working hours, hybrid working and the possibility of workcations (in accordance with our company policy)
  • We always remember to have fun along the way, both in our day-to-day work and at our regular team events on site in our offices in Munich, Copenhagen, Odense, Lisbon and Prague or online
  • You are the most valuable asset to our company which is why we‚Äôre happy to offer awesome benefits like our personal development budget, job-related language courses and a lot more (depending on your location) to focus on your well being

About Us

We are driven by our values #BeBrave, #BetterTogether, #LeadbyExample, #InnovateWithPurpose, #PassionForPrivacy, #GiveBack and #ComeAsYouAre. They show what we believe in and how we work. They help make our team special and guide us in everything we do. They're the heart of our company and inspire us to do our best every day.

We strive to create a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment (DEI) where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to reach their full potential. We believe that our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are our greatest strengths ‚Äî so we are committed to building with them as we foster innovation and drive our success.

We recognize that this is an ongoing journey. We commit to listening and to continuous learning, growth, and improvement. By embracing DEI principles, we will create a more just and equitable society, and we are proud to play our part in making this vision a reality.

We are #BetterTogether.

Title: Data Analyst at Boost inc (B2B Tech)
Description:
At A Glance

We‚Äôre one of the fastest-growing companies in unattended retail tech - 150+ people, 5 countries, hundreds of customers, and a product that‚Äôs redefining how the world shops.

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our growing data team.

We‚Äôre looking for someone who thrives in a scale-up environment and enjoys structuring and managing BI platforms by implementing data governance principles to ensure consistency, reliability, and secure access.

As our data analyst, you will play a key role in supporting Boostbar (our fast-growing operator in Switzerland) as well as Boost inc‚Äôs technology teams. You will turn data into actionable insights for both internal and external stakeholders.

What You'll Do


Collaborate cross-functionally with operations, sales, category management, and finance teams to understand business needs and translate them into robust analytical solutions.
Serve as a bridge between business and data teams, gathering requirements, defining technical specs, and ensuring alignment throughout projects.
Develop and maintain BI dashboards and reports to support strategic and operational decision-making across the organisation.
Work with data and ML engineers to ensure data quality and to operationalise insights (e.g., forecasting, recommendations), while proactively identifying KPIs, trends, and growth opportunities through effective data storytelling.


What You'll Bring


Strong analytical background, with experience in BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Superset) and a proven ability to translate business needs into actionable data solutions.
Skilled in managing dashboards as data products, ensuring quality, usability, and clear documentation.
Excellent communicator, fluent in English, with a track record of collaborating effectively across cross-functional teams.
Bonus points for Python skills, experience with cloud-based platforms like Databricks, background in retail/FMCG/vending, and additional language proficiency (especially German or other European languages).


Why Join Us


Exceptional learning opportunities. You will be part of a fast growing scale-up with a dynamic team, with the opportunity to learn from a highly talented group of people and have a real impact across the company.
The chance to work at the intersection of technology and operations, influencing critical business decisions.
Offices in Zurich, London, and 4 other countries - but no office politics
The usual: budget for personal development


About Us

Boost inc is a global leader in unattended retail technology, redefining traditional vending by transforming it into modern, digital retail experiences. Headquartered in Switzerland, with a dedicated technology hub in the UK, our team of over 150 professionals works across Zurich, London, and offices in four additional countries. Since our founding, we‚Äôve empowered more than 400 customers across Europe and beyond - including vending operators, OEMs, and consumer brands - with cutting-edge solutions designed to drive operational efficiency, business growth, and engaging consumer experiences.

Here you can find more information:

www.boostinc.com / www.boostbar.ch

Title: Data Market Analyst ‚Äì Business Planning
Description:
Imagine a world with zero vehicle accidents, zero vehicle emissions, and wireless vehicle connectivity all around us. Every day, we move closer to making that world a reality. Aptiv‚Äôs passionate team of engineers and developers creates advanced safety systems, high-performance electrification solutions and data connectivity solutions so that automakers can bring advanced capabilities to more people around the globe. This is how we enable sustainable mobility and help to prevent accidents caused by human error.

Want to join us?

Your role:


Conduct internal planning data analysis, transform data into knowledge to provide input for decision, compare data with Market industry-level to support operational and strategic initiatives.
Monitor market share, competitive intelligence, product development trends and EDS portfolio to support market positioning reports.
Align data analysis with company‚Äôs strategic direction. Initiate and support market research and competitor analysis by developing automatization of different data sources.
Collaborate with external research and consulting firms to provide insights to internal functions and leadership.
Participate in customer studies and market environment analysis.
Maintain up-to-date understanding of the EMEA wiring harness market, including key drivers such as electrification, regulatory shifts, consumer behavior, and regional trends.
Contribute to general business planning tasks as needed and support Commercial Teams in regards current and future business.


Your Background


Graduate or Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field
Strong proficiency in SQL, Microsoft Excel, and Power BI.
Working knowledge of SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS).
Excellent command of office applications, including PowerPoint and Excel.
Familiarity with Automotive product portfolios and market forecasting.
Experience in market research, data analysis, or a related function.
Fluent in English, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
Able to perform under pressure, work collaboratively, and meet deadlines.


Nice To Have Skills


Experience with VBA, Power Query, Power Pivot, or Power Automate.
Automotive supplier background or direct exposure to manufacturing and business planning in the automotive sector.


Why join us?


You can grow at Aptiv. Aptiv provides an inclusive work environment where all individuals can grow and develop, regardless of gender, ethnicity or beliefs.
You can have an impact. Safety is a core Aptiv value; we want a safer world for us and our children, one with: Zero fatalities, Zero injuries, Zero accidents.
You have support. We ensure you have the resources and support you need to take care of your family and your physical and mental health with a competitive health insurance package.


Privacy Notice - Active Candidates: https://www.aptiv.com/privacy-notice-active-candidates

Aptiv is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee - Real Assets
Description:
About The Job


Data is a strategic asset for BNP Paribas. It plays a fundamental role in the analysis of the teams‚Äô performance and evolution ultimately allowing to become more efficient and to contribute to the sustainability of the business model and the accurate selection of the bank‚Äôs assets. To be in control of data is crucial to enhance risk management, to reach right credit decisions and bring added value to the business
Based in Lisbon, the Trainee will join a team of professionals who are known for their sectorial knowledge and support the team


Your Main Activities Are


Input missing data on credit files for presentation to the Credit Committee
Ensure accuracy of credit data
Ensure consistency of data between different credit files
Communicate with the CPM Credit Analyst Teams aiming to get updates on progress of credit files
Ensure proper understanding of credit files to identify structured data to be inputted
Create and maintain standard procedures for data input (user guides)
Cooperate and communicate with the teams in charge of the golden source systems to ensure correct data in the source system
Produce periodic reports based on data collected and captured, providing clear analysis and interpretation


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Economics, Accounting or Management
Detail oriented with deep interest in data
Good knowledge of Excel
Good written/verbal communication skills in English (mandatory)
Ability to collaborate / teamwork
Efficient organizational and planning capacities
Self-starter, good initiative and flexible


About The Team


The Real Assets team includes a Coverage Relationship & Origination team, a Transaction & Execution team and a Credit Portfolio Management Team (CPM) spread across several countries serving the sector client in EMEA. These teams are split across Transportation (Shipping & Offshore, Aviation, Rail), Real Estate, Energy, Recourses & Infrastructure (ERI), Export, Leasing & Alternative Structuring. This transversality aims to provide a common training path, opportunities to explore other sectors, more efficiency and greater mobility


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.
