Title: Data Analyst (Hybrid)
HTML:
A Company you will be happy to grow with!


At InnoTech, it‚Äôs all about connecting people with business through technology.

We care about you, your happiness, and your well-being. We seek passionate individuals eager to learn and improve their skills with us ‚Äì growth is in our DNA. This dedication has earned us recognition as a Best Workplace in Portugal for 2023 and 2024. Furthermore, in 2024, we were proudly acknowledged as one of the top IT companies to work for in Portugal, receiving the Best Workplace award in the IT sector, given by Great Place to Work.


For us, sustainability is not just a word. Integrity and social responsibility lead our behavior.

We dare to be different, ambitious, dream big, and deliver value like no other! You can work with top-level partners in banking, insurance, retail, telecommunications, financial services, and more!


Join our team of 180+ InnoTechers and bring your talent as a Data Analyst.


Your Mission Will Be:

  • Collaborate with stakeholders from different sectors to identify and understand their specific analytical needs and challenges;
  • Map business requirements to existing analytics product functionality, identifying opportunities for improvement and customization;
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using Power BI to provide actionable insights;
  • Ensure the quality and integrity of the data used for analysis.


You Will Need:

  • Minimum of 2 years experience in data analysis;
  • Proven proficiency in the Power BI tool, including development of dashboards and reports;
  • Ability to translate business needs into technical specifications;
  • Fluency in Portuguese and English (other languages are a plus);
  • CPLP nationality or an EU work permit is required to facilitate employment.


Would Be Awesome If You Have:

  • BSc or MSc in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Technology, or related fields;
  • Experience in query languages such as SQL;
  • Familiarity with business intelligence principles and data management practices.


With Us You Can Be a:

  • TechThinker ‚Äì people who want to re-imagine technology with us
  • TechSolver ‚Äì strategic, resilient, and a little bit of a puzzle lover
  • InnoMinder ‚Äì inhale innovation, exhale digital transformation
  • InnoTecher ‚Äì no words needed. Just happiness, talent, and all the above!


Are you convinced? Come see it for yourself.

Join our Top-Notch Team!

Title: Junior Healthcare Data Analyst
HTML:
Learn About Knok

At knok, we dare to lead and humanize the digital transformation of healthcare. We envision a world where everyone has timely access to quality healthcare through digital technology, creating a more equal society. We genuinely believe in it and you can recognise it in every person who embraces this mission. We are rapidly growing, delivering augmented telemedicine on 4 continents, and we have barely begun!

About The Role

We are looking for a Junior Healthcare Data Analyst to support our teams in turning complex healthcare data into meaningful insights. You'll be working with datasets from different sources, such as clinical operations, insurance processing, and patient journeys - helping us improve care delivery and decision-making.

If you're passionate about using data to make healthcare more accessible and effective, don't stop here - dive deeper!

As an Junior Healthcare Data Analyst, you will:

  • Collect, clean, and analyse healthcare data from multiple sources (e.g. EHR, patient demographics, operational systems), to extract meaningful insights;
  • Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualisations to communicate key metrics and findings to stakeholders, including clinicians, operational teams and leadership team;
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with teams across the organisation, including data science, product management, and clinical operations, to support data-driven decision-making;
  • Perform statistical analysis to support population health management, risk stratification, and clinical outcome optimisation;
  • Contribute to improving data quality by identifying data quality issues and anomalies, and work with relevant stakeholders to address and resolve them

What Makes You a Great Fit For This Journey

  • Bachelor's degree in Biomedical Engineering, Medical Statistics, Biomedical Sciences, Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Health Informatics, or a related field. Master's degree preferred;
  • Experience (academic or professional) with data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Power BI or similar;
  • Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques;
  • Ability to turn complex data into clear insights that support better decision-making;
  • Knowledge of programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and statistical modeling;
  • Ability to explain a dashboard or an analysis to someone without a technical background, in a simple and practical way;
  • Care when working with data to ensure accuracy, consistency and reliability;
  • Ability to manage several analytical tasks at the same time, prioritising what has the greatest impact on the business and patients

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join our team and start a new adventure in an international and dynamic environment, where you will be able to fulfil your career expectations in a fast growing organization.

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will be part of our corporate team, working closely with various departments to transform data into insights and value-added solutions that support strategic decision making and improve performance across the organization.




Your missions

Design, develop and deploy machine learning models to solve business problems
Collect, clean and process structured and unstructured data from multiple sources
Perform statistical analysis and predictive modeling to uncover trends and patterns
Develop dashboards and data visualization tools to communicate findings
Collaborate with IT and business teams to integrate models into operational systems
Validate models and ensure robustness, scalability, and reliability
Stay up to date with the latest data science trends, technologies, and best practices
Document solutions, prepare technical reports, and present results to stakeholders




Your profile

Academic background: bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or similar
Experience with data manipulation and analysis using Python and libraries like pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn
Proficiency in machine learning algorithms and statistical modeling techniques
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Plotly
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and databases (SQL, NoSQL)
Fluent English. French is a plus.
You are analytical, curious, and business-oriented, with excellent communication skills




What we offer

An international community bringing together 110+ different nationalities
An environment where trust has a central place: 70% of our key leaders started their careers at the first level of responsibilities
A robust training system with our internal Academy and 250+ available modules
A vibrant workplace that frequently gathers for internal events (afterworks, team buildings, etc.)




Remote policy: Possibility to work remotely up to 2 days per week

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Transformation, adaptability and innovation are part of our DNA.

We're passionate about technology and we want to be part of your story.

Do we share the same passion? You've come to the right place, Smart.




As a Personal Data Protection Analyst, you will play a key role in ensuring that daily GDPR business-as-usual activities are executed within the 1st Line of Defense (1LoD). You will support CIB clients in achieving compliance with Privacy by Design principles and other data protection requirements, working closely with the CIB Central Data Office, the SPOC network (1LoD), and the DPC/DPO network (2LoD).

This role requires both strong technical expertise in data privacy and GDPR as well as excellent communication and organizational skills, as you will interact with diverse stakeholders across the organization.




Key Responsibilities

Ensure CIB project validation processes comply with Privacy by Design principles, supporting Project Managers in data protection activities.
Manage internal and external requests in the CIB GDPR DESK inbox, including Data Subject Rights Requests.
Prepare and publish the CIB GDPR DESK periodic report and maintain a dedicated SharePoint space.
Contribute to the dissemination of a culture of personal data protection within CIB.
Develop and share best practices with the data protection network.




Required Competencies

Minimum 5 years of experience in data privacy, including significant hands-on work with EU GDPR.
Academic background or certification related to EU GDPR (mandatory).
Knowledge of other global privacy laws and regulations is a strong plus.




Technical Skills

Full proficiency with the MS Office Suite.
Proficiency with project management tools and methodologies.




Language Skills

Fluent English (C1‚ÄìC2), both written and spoken.




Soft Skills

Excellent writing, communication, and interpersonal skills.
Strong attention to detail, with a high sense of rigor and organization.
Ability to synthesize and simplify complex concepts for senior stakeholders.
Proactive mindset, able to leverage transversal networks.
High adaptability and ability to work in a changing environment.




What will you find at SMART?




A dynamic, hard-working and co-operative team;

Career plan and defined objectives;

Initial and ongoing training ;

Follow-up meetings and performance appraisals;

Business bonuses;

Personal and family benefits;

Numerous events, partnerships and internal dynamics;

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation and Professional Pride. Do you identify with these values?

Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity," Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

By developing projects in the most diverse industries ‚Äì Banking, Telecommunications, Health, Retail, Energy, Insurance or Aviation - we analyze data, transforming it into knowledge for our clients, allowing them to adopt the best decision-making for their respective organizations and businesses.




We seek a Data Analyst willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team.

Hybrid working mode with base in Porto.




Main Tasks:

‚Ä¢ Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.

‚Ä¢ Creative descriptive, predictive, and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholder‚Äôs decision making.

‚Ä¢ Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining.




Technical Skills:

‚Ä¢ Data knowledge / Data processing / Data quality / IT Development

‚Ä¢ Database Management (SQL)

‚Ä¢ Methodologies (Agile)

‚Ä¢ Office Pack (MS Excel)

‚Ä¢ Power BI / Tableau




Language Skills:

‚Ä¢ English - Expert

‚Ä¢ French - Expert




Soft Skills:

‚Ä¢ IT - Business/IT relationship

‚Ä¢ Analytical Ability

‚Ä¢ Data Intelligence, Research and Quant Analytics

‚Ä¢ Ability to understand, explain and support change

‚Ä¢ Ability to collaborate/Teamwork

‚Ä¢ Attention to detail/rigor




If you believe in this match as much as we do, send your CV to leonor.carvalho@closer.pt and reach the closest side of life.




Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst ‚Äì Alteryx
Description:
Welcome to Felps Lisboa




üëã A community of passionate experts who combine their skills to take your company to higher levels of excellence. üöÄ




üîí Our expertise: The Felps Group is an alliance of ‚ÄòPure Players‚Äô made up of four distinct squads: Telecoms, IT, Cybersecurity and Change Management. Each squad is led by a Captain who is a specialist in that particular area. The captains coach the consultants throughout their careers in the Felps Group, guiding them in their choice of missions and the stages of their training. Our aim is to facilitate the growth and development of our consultants, enabling them to take their careers to the next level.




üåê Our approach: In our model, consultants are the central focus, which is why we dedicate all our attention to them. The team, led by the Captain and Associate Director, provides expert support to ensure the consultants receive the highest level of guidance. Drawing on our extensive experience, we are able to deliver personalized, comprehensive, and impactful assistance tailored to their needs.




üëâüèº Felps Group believes in the power of diversity and inclusion. We are committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all employees feel respected, supported and encouraged to contribute to the company.

As a member of our team, you will be part of a culture that celebrates diversity in all its forms, be it age, gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, skills, socio-economic background or any other personal characteristic. We pride ourselves on our commitment to equal opportunities and justice.

We encourage applications from all qualified candidates, including people with disabilities who are accredited by DGERT/IEFP. We are committed to providing an inclusive work environment and accommodation to support the integration of all our employees. If you have any specific accessibility requirements during the recruitment process, please let us know and we will do our best to support you.




We are looking for a skilled Data Analyst specialized in Alteryx, experienced in handling date/time datasets (PDATEN), and capable of transforming complex data into actionable insights to support strategic decision-making.




Your Key Responsibilities:

Design, build, and optimize Alteryx workflows for analytics and reporting.
Integrate Alteryx solutions with BI platforms such as Tableau and Power BI.
Collaborate with international teams to gather and translate requirements.
Ensure compliance with data governance and security standards.
Prepare, transform, and analyze temporal datasets, ensuring consistency and quality in pipelines and BI reports.

Requirements:

Proven experience with Alteryx Designer and Server.
Strong SQL and ETL knowledge.
Experience in data modeling and analytics projects.
Fluency in English is mandatory; French is highly valued.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Technical Skills Required:

Alteryx workflow design and optimization.
SQL querying and data transformation.
ETL processes for structured and temporal datasets.
Integration with BI tools (Tableau, Power BI).
Data quality control, consistency checks, and reporting standards compliance.




Transform data into actionable insights and join our Felps Lisboa team today!

  • Design, build, and optimize Alteryx workflows for analytics and reporting.
  • Integrate Alteryx solutions with BI platforms such as Tableau and Power BI.
  • Collaborate with international teams to gather and translate requirements.
  • Ensure compliance with data governance and security standards.
  • Prepare, transform, and analyze temporal datasets, ensuring consistency and quality in pipelines and BI reports.

Requirements:

  • Proven experience with Alteryx Designer and Server.
  • Strong SQL and ETL knowledge.
  • Experience in data modeling and analytics projects.
  • Fluency in English is mandatory; French is highly valued.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Technical Skills Required:

  • Alteryx workflow design and optimization.
  • SQL querying and data transformation.
  • ETL processes for structured and temporal datasets.
  • Integration with BI tools (Tableau, Power BI).
  • Data quality control, consistency checks, and reporting standards compliance.


Transform data into actionable insights and join our Felps Lisboa team today!

Title: Reporting Specialist - Porto, Portugal
Description:
Come and work with us.




We are looking for a talented and accomplished Reporting Specialist to join our team. The purpose of this role is to directly assist the reporting team by collecting and reporting all KPIs data from Foundever Operations, Supporting Departments and Leadership.




As a Reporting Specialist, your daily responsibilities will include:




Under limited supervision, prepare and maintain databases & statistical reports used in financial/quality/performance management decision-making.
Investigate and analyze data and decide upon alternatives to complete assignments.
Assemble and assess statistical information from system databases and other sources.
Independently plan, prepare and maintain business unit reports critical to organizational success/profitability and meeting client expectations.
Investigate, analyze and assess trends and campaign/brand activity.
Monitor, evaluate and assess unit productivity on a daily basis.
Communicate with the manager on a daily basis to resolve problems/issues, assess scores/trends and maximize efficiency.
Additional operations support duties as assigned.
Creation of ‚Äúad hoc‚Äù reports under short timelines
Takes personal responsibility to understand and comply with all company and client security requirements and policies.




To succeed in the role, you will need to have:




English C1 advanced level
Strong computer, communication and analytical skills.
Strong knowledge Microsoft Excel
Microsoft Access/Database skills appreciated
Power BI experience is highly valued
VBA knowledge/experience is highly valued
SQL knowledge/experience is highly valued
SAP Business Objects knowledge/experience highly valued
Data Architecture knowledge/experience is highly valued
Ability to collect and assess large sets of data, dashboard creation and KPI evaluation.
Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Ability to work with minimal supervision, make independent decisions and solve complex problems
Strong understanding of the call center industry and operations,
Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment,
Demonstrated ability to develop professional relationships and interact with all levels of internal and external clients.
Solution driven mindset
Must hold EU citizenship or valid work permit for Portugal
Be a local candidate or willing to relocate to Porto, Portugal
Availability to work 100% from our site in Porto




Education and experience.




Minimum 1 year experience as Reporting Specialist or Real Time Analyst




Benefits.




Competitive wages
Paid professional training
Employee discounts
Private healthcare & dental insurance (after six months of employment)
Growth opportunities through various development programs
Fun and engaging company-wide initiatives, including our EverBetter wellness program
Job stability
Life-long skills and experience
Excellent work culture




Go further with Foundever¬Æ




We believe in memorable associate experiences. Here, you can improve your quality of life and grow your career.




Apply today!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
A Company you will be happy to grow with!




At InnoTech, it¬¥s all about connecting people with business through technology.

We care about you, your happiness, and your well-being. We seek people who want to learn and further improve their skills with us ‚Äì growth is part of our DNA, and that‚Äôs why we‚Äôre proud to be certified as a Great Place to Work and to be among the Top 50 Best Workplaces in Portugal! For us, sustainability is not just a word. Integrity and social responsibility lead our behavior.




We dare to be different, ambitious, dream big, and deliver value like no other! You will have the opportunity to work with top-level partners in the banking area, insurance, retail, telecommunications, financial services, and so much more!




We are 180+ InnoTechers, and we want your talent as a Data Analyst.




Your Mission Will Be:

Collaborate with stakeholders across various sectors to identify and understand their analytical needs and challenges;
Map business requirements to existing analytics product functionality, identifying opportunities for enhancement and customization;
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using Power BI, ensuring they deliver actionable insights;
Ensure the quality and integrity of the data used for analysis.




You Will Need:

Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis;
Proven proficiency in the Power BI tool, including development of dashboards and reports;
Experience working with Snowflake and Azure Databricks;
Fluency in Portuguese and English;
CPLP nationality or an EU work permit is required to facilitate employment.




Would Be Awesome If You Have:

BSc or MSc in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Technology, or related fields;
Experience working with SQL Server.




With Us You Can Be a:

TechThinker ‚Äì people who want to re-imagine technology with us
TechSolver ‚Äì strategic, resilient, and a little bit of a puzzle lover
InnoMinder ‚Äì inhale innovation, exhale digital transformation
InnoTecher ‚Äì no words needed. Just happiness, talent, and all the above!




Are you convinced? Come see it for yourself.

Join our Top-Notch Team!

Title: Data Science Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer


A chance to grow your analytics skills in a supportive, international environment.
Direct exposure to real-world business challenges and data-driven strategy.
Mentorship from experienced data scientists and analysts.
Opportunities to evolve toward more advanced data science roles.
Dynamic and diverse team within one of the leading global fashion brands.
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.



What you will do


Support data-driven decision-making by preparing and analyzing data related to customer behavior, CRM performance, and sales across multiple channels.
Work closely with data scientists and business stakeholders to translate business questions into meaningful insights.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to support data science model development.
Use Python and SQL to clean, process, and visualize data in support of analytics and modeling projects.
Apply basic statistical methods (e.g. descriptive statistics, correlation analysis, hypothesis testing) to uncover insights.
Ensure data quality and consistency across sources by collaborating with data engineering and IT teams.
Communicate findings clearly through presentations and storytelling.
Actively participate in sprint planning, reviews, and agile ceremonies within the team.



What you‚Äôll bring


1‚Äì2 years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, or a related data role (internships included).
Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Economics, Business Analytics, or Engineering.
Experience working with data using SQL and Python (pandas, matplotlib/seaborn).
Experience with PySpark and Spark technologies is a strong plus, but not mandatory.
Basic understanding of statistics and its application in business analytics.
Strong attention to detail, curiosity, and eagerness to learn.
Good communication skills, including the ability to explain data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Team player with a proactive mindset and willingness to grow in a collaborative environment.
Fluency in English (written and spoken)



Nice to have:


Exposure to cloud platforms like AWS, Azure or Databricks.
Knowledge of Python packages used in machine learning (e.g. scikit-learn).
Participation in academic or personal analytics projects



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.
Show more
HTML:
Who We Are

Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer

  • A chance to grow your analytics skills in a supportive, international environment.
  • Direct exposure to real-world business challenges and data-driven strategy.
  • Mentorship from experienced data scientists and analysts.
  • Opportunities to evolve toward more advanced data science roles.
  • Dynamic and diverse team within one of the leading global fashion brands.
  • Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.


What you will do

  • Support data-driven decision-making by preparing and analyzing data related to customer behavior, CRM performance, and sales across multiple channels.
  • Work closely with data scientists and business stakeholders to translate business questions into meaningful insights.
  • Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to support data science model development.
  • Use Python and SQL to clean, process, and visualize data in support of analytics and modeling projects.
  • Apply basic statistical methods (e.g. descriptive statistics, correlation analysis, hypothesis testing) to uncover insights.
  • Ensure data quality and consistency across sources by collaborating with data engineering and IT teams.
  • Communicate findings clearly through presentations and storytelling.
  • Actively participate in sprint planning, reviews, and agile ceremonies within the team.


What you‚Äôll bring

  • 1‚Äì2 years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, or a related data role (internships included).
  • Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Economics, Business Analytics, or Engineering.
  • Experience working with data using SQL and Python (pandas, matplotlib/seaborn).
  • Experience with PySpark and Spark technologies is a strong plus, but not mandatory.
  • Basic understanding of statistics and its application in business analytics.
  • Strong attention to detail, curiosity, and eagerness to learn.
  • Good communication skills, including the ability to explain data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Team player with a proactive mindset and willingness to grow in a collaborative environment.
  • Fluency in English (written and spoken)


Nice to have:

  • Exposure to cloud platforms like AWS, Azure or Databricks.
  • Knowledge of Python packages used in machine learning (e.g. scikit-learn).
  • Participation in academic or personal analytics projects


In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Risk Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

Within the Group RISK Function, the main mission of RISK EM is to manage credit risk, counterparty risk, market risk and operational risk within the Retail Banking perimeter, which covers Central Europe (Poland, Ukraine), Turkey and the Maghreb (Morocco and Algeria) to:


Contribute to the implementation of a robust risk management framework within the scope,
Monitor and control risks on its perimeter, providing a dynamic and comprehensive analysis of all the risks incurred within its scope,
Ensure compliance with banking regulations in the risk area, in conjunction with the relevant functions within its scope.


Your Main Activities Are

Supporting the EM Risk teams


Framework, planning and budgeting of work
Coordination and development of supporting materials in response to ad hoc requests from the Group (e.g. Stress Tests, ETS, CRR impact study)
Participate in the preparation of materials & minutes for project committees, steering committees and strategic committees (AQC)
Ensure the update of EM policies on non-performing loans, and coordinate cascading within EM entities and monitor operational implementation.
Production of adequate documentation in line with Group Documentation


As part of B-Ready program for the implementation of CRR3 guidelines,


Coordinate actions to ensure the sourcing of CRR3 data, and support EM entities in the certification phase of the calculation of the CRR3 RWA.
Integration of additional regulatory data into local systems required to calculate the RWA according to the Bale 4 standards.
Coordination of the certification phase (Dry Run) and support to entities for data verification, understanding and interpretation of results, as well as implementation of action plans.


Supporting the Risk EM central teams as a PMO on the Prudential Backstops project


Support entities for the shortfall computation, in respect of the timeline imposed by the regulator and by the Group.
Organize workshops with entities and ensure the minutes with the monitoring of action / decisions exchanges.
Collect, control and consolidate the shortfall computed by entities,
Lead the building of the forecast assumption of provisioning evolution.


Ensure the data collection for the Stress Test EBA 2023 and Stress Test CRE


Collect Group needs and share the instructions to EM entities
Monitor the progress of the work in relation to the plans imposed.
Provide support to EM entities in their collection work (prioritization, identification of alternative solutions in case of missing data


Coordinate The Data Reliability Actions Used To Meet The Calculation Needs Of IFRS9 Provisions (Stages 1, 2 And 3), Shortfalls Computation And More Generally On All Projects Monitored By The Team


Support BMCI in identifying data corrections/development, defining and operational monitoring of action plans with a view to improving reliability and data collection.
Monitor the correction actions and the implementation of IT roadmaps for data implementation, feeding and control.


Monitor the implementation of indicators of financial difficulties in the credit process


Monitoring the integration of UTP in the credit process, in the respect of the regulatory deliverables.
Maintenance of the UTP dashboard for monitoring UTP deployment.
Communicate and control the application of updated instructions.


Profile And Skills To Success


2/3 years of experience in same or related field
Data knowledge
Risk analysis
Culture Transformation Change Management
Process improvement
Project management
Active collaboration
Adaptability
English (mandatory): fluent
French (recommended): Operational


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst (French Speaker) - CRM
Description:
Company Description

Natixis in Portugal is a Centre of Expertise whose mission is to transform traditional banking by developing innovative solutions for the business, operations and work culture of Groupe BPCE worldwide.

Natixis in Portugal is part of the Global Financial Services division, where it applies technology for the development of financial expertise in its two global business lines ‚Äì Corporate & Investment Banking and Asset & Wealth Management ‚Äì and, transversally, for the entities of Groupe BPCE.

The Centre of Expertise, based in Porto, currently has more than 2,400 employees from over 30 nationalities, organised in three main departments: Information Technology, Banking Support Activities and Compliance. These teams work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting and creating value for all the business lines and platforms of the group. The project in Porto is one of the biggest investments in Human Resources ever made by Groupe BPCE worldwide.

A disruptive mindset and a culture of proximity and agility identify Natixis in Portugal Team and reflect the company's mission to transform traditional banking at a global scale: a perfect match in the Portuguese dynamics and entrepreneurial ecosystem.

In 2024, Top Employers Institute has awarded Natixis in Portugal the Top Employer Portugal accreditation for the second time. This certification recognizes excellence in people practices, following the example of our head office, in France, who was certified Top Employer France for the eight year in a row.

Job Description

Team presentation and main goal:

The data engineer is a computer developer whose mission is to implement the collection and availability of data within the company. They are also responsible for industrializing and putting into production processes on the data (for example: providing dashboards, integrating statistical models) in collaboration with business teams and the teams that analyze them.

Main Tasks And Goals

Production (50%)


Ensure production monitoring and maintenance - Feed the CRM and other recurring programs.
Ensure documentation of processes.
Automate manual processes if necessary.
Develop technical solutions that meet business needs.


Management (25%)


Implement, monitor, and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) for marketing campaigns.
Participate in the preparation and analysis of marketing campaign reports.


Business Requests (20%)


Analyze and understand expressed business needs.
Prioritize requests based on their impact and the company‚Äôs priorities.
Respond to requests within the specified deadlines, proposing suitable solutions.
Rigorously document processes and analyses performed.
Implement automation solutions to optimize efficiency and task recurrence.


Appendices (5%)


Conduct in-depth ad hoc analyses:
Perform thorough analyses on Additional Business activities.
Actively participate in the migration of SAS systems to more modern technologies, in collaboration with the relevant teams.


Qualifications


Holder of a higher education degree (Master's level minimum) in statistics, computer science, data science, finance, or a related field.
Significant experience of at least three (3) years as a Data Analyst / Data Engineer, ideally acquired in the banking sector.
Expert in data engineering: organize, automate, and optimize data production processes.
Proven experience in managing complex data flows.
Expert proficiency in SQL language.
Advanced proficiency in Alteryx (Server and Desktop).
Knowledge and ability to understand existing SAS scripts.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite.
In-depth knowledge of the banking sector.
Proficient in Power BI for data visualization.
Experience in project management, demonstrating the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and meet deadlines.
Fluent in English and French (minimum B2).


Soft Skills


Communicative.
Analytical and synthesis mindset.
Critical sense and ability to identify errors and inconsistencies.
Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate effectively with different types of stakeholders, especially in presenting results and recommendations.


We will only consider English Cv's.

Additional Information

At Natixis, we are committed to fostering a working environment where each and every one of our people is treated with dignity and respect and where every voice is heard. Our differences make us collectively stronger and are a source of fulfilment, innovation and performance.

In the framework of its Diversity, Equity & Inclusion policy, Natixis in Portugal has implemented a Blind CV Screening process, with the purpose of reducing hiring bias. A blind CV excludes any personal details which refer to the applicant‚Äôs gender, age or ethnicity. When applying for our positions, please submit a blind CV, that is, with no picture, name, gender, age, nationality, ethnicity and address. Your personal statement, work experience, courses and certifications, education, skills and contact information is what matters to us.

#MuchMoreThanJustAJob

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. Start your day having breakfast with the Team and grab fresh fruit on the way to your seat, in one of Porto‚Äôs most typical neighborhoods. This Purple Day is going to be a busy one: daily meeting ensuring all team members are on the same page regarding work status, priorities and blockers, language class and, just after, a Talent Management meeting with your manager, discussing your career path.

Lunch break. Today, your Team is onboarding newcomers, but also welcoming French colleagues: the perfect excuse to walk downtown and bond over a francesinha. When returning, inhale nature and peace of mind in Natixis Urban Garden (look at the crops; ready to harvest!).

Back inside. Brainstorming session on a new, exciting project in our disruptive and immersive Manaus Village. The afternoon went flying (tasks, meetings, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: celebrating cultural diversity with a Diwali, the Indian festival of lights.

Tomorrow, you attend a conference led by influential speakers in your industry and, the day after, you will work from home, benefitting from some focus time to complete that report and soft skills course on LinkedIn Learning. Once you are done with your work for the day, strike the right note playing with Natixis band or be part of a board games session. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to catch some waves or sail the Douro river during golden hour.

Title: CRM Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT US üöÄ

Hostelworld Group, the global hostel-focussed online booking platform, inspires adventurous minds to meet the world and come back with life-changing stories to tell. Our customers are not your average tourists, they crave cultural connection and unique experiences that we make possible by providing an unbeatable selection of hostels in unmissable locations ‚Äì all in the palm of their hand.

It is the social nature and community feel of hostels and their environment, that enable travellers to embrace journeys of discovery, adventure and meaning. We have more than 13 million reviews across 17,800 hostels in more than 179 countries, making the brand the leading online hub for social travel. The website operates in 19 different languages and our mobile app in 13 languages.

Founded in 1999 and headquartered in Dublin, Hostelworld has a growing, high-calibre team of 230 people within Technology, Product, Global Markets, HR, Finance & Legal and Marketing Teams across our Dublin, London, Porto, Shanghai and Sydney offices. Hostelworld is listed on the London Stock Exchange and Dublin Euronext. You can read more about our story here.




LOCATIONüåç

This role is based in Portugal. We have an office hub in Porto available for those who prefer a hybrid model where you can spend time with colleagues in-person. You will need to be able to commute to our office hub as required from time to time.




WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH üë®üèΩ‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüë®üèº

We have a matrixed structure here at Hostelworld; with Growth teams comprising of people across Technology, Product, Marketing and Analytics & Insights (A&I) ‚Äì all working towards one common goal with aligned objectives.

This role sits in the Mobile Analytics Team reporting to the Head of Growth Analytics. We are seeking a CRM Analyst to play a crucial role in enhancing our customer relationships through data-driven insights. You will be instrumental in analysing customer behaviours, segmenting audiences, and optimising our marketing efforts to improve customer engagement and retention. This role is ideal for someone who is passionate about leveraging data to drive business decisions and enhance the customer journey in the travel sector. You will be working with best in class technology and working within a wider motivated team of data analysts, engineers and scientists.

Our core data stack:

Front End Tracking: Google Analytics
CDP: Segment
CRM: Iterable
Data Storage: GCP & Snowflake
Data Visualisation and Usage: Tableau, Snowflake, Vertex AI
Orchestration: Airflow
Transformation: DBT
Synching data: Fivetran, Hightouch, Twilio Segment




WHAT YOU'LL DO üë©‚Äçüíª

Develop and maintain segments for personalised marketing campaigns based on customer behaviour, demographic data, and booking patterns.
Analyse CRM data to provide actionable insights on customer lifecycle, loyalty, and retention.
Collaborate with the mobile team to design, test, and optimize campaigns across multiple channels.
Monitor and report on the performance of CRM initiatives, providing regular updates to senior management on their impact on revenue and customer engagement.
Manage the integration of new data sources into the CRM system to ensure a holistic view of the customer.
Utilise advanced analytical techniques to predict customer behaviours and identify opportunities for growth and improvement.




WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR üëÄ

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in CRM analytics or a related field, preferably in the travel or tech industry.
Strong analytical skills with experience in SQL, Excel, and CRM software (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot).
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Knowledge of statistical modeling and data mining techniques is a plus.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
Knowledge of agile project management and familiarity with working alongside engineering teams to prioritize product enhancements.




WHAT WE OFFER üíØ

Competitive salary & benefits
Enhanced annual leave plus 3 Wellbeing Days per year
Paid family leave (maternity, paternity, surrogacy & adoption)
Agile working (plus a Working from Abroad Policy!)
Support for your ongoing growth & development
Inclusive people policies (sickness, menopause, compassionate and fertility leave)
A chance to give back to your local community with 5 paid volunteering days




We believe in talented and diverse teams that reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we operate. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences. We lay out the above requirements to guide applicants to the experiences that we believe will allow you to be successful in the role. If you don‚Äôt meet them all, please consider applying if you think you can still perform the role as described.

Show more
HTML:
ABOUT US üöÄ

Hostelworld Group, the global hostel-focussed online booking platform, inspires adventurous minds to meet the world and come back with life-changing stories to tell. Our customers are not your average tourists, they crave cultural connection and unique experiences that we make possible by providing an unbeatable selection of hostels in unmissable locations ‚Äì all in the palm of their hand.

It is the social nature and community feel of hostels and their environment, that enable travellers to embrace journeys of discovery, adventure and meaning. We have more than 13 million reviews across 17,800 hostels in more than 179 countries, making the brand the leading online hub for social travel. The website operates in 19 different languages and our mobile app in 13 languages.

Founded in 1999 and headquartered in Dublin, Hostelworld has a growing, high-calibre team of 230 people within Technology, Product, Global Markets, HR, Finance & Legal and Marketing Teams across our Dublin, London, Porto, Shanghai and Sydney offices. Hostelworld is listed on the London Stock Exchange and Dublin Euronext. You can read more about our story here.


LOCATIONüåç

This role is based in Portugal. We have an office hub in Porto available for those who prefer a hybrid model where you can spend time with colleagues in-person. You will need to be able to commute to our office hub as required from time to time.


WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH üë®üèΩ‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüë®üèº

We have a matrixed structure here at Hostelworld; with Growth teams comprising of people across Technology, Product, Marketing and Analytics & Insights (A&I) ‚Äì all working towards one common goal with aligned objectives.

This role sits in the Mobile Analytics Team reporting to the Head of Growth Analytics. We are seeking a CRM Analyst to play a crucial role in enhancing our customer relationships through data-driven insights. You will be instrumental in analysing customer behaviours, segmenting audiences, and optimising our marketing efforts to improve customer engagement and retention. This role is ideal for someone who is passionate about leveraging data to drive business decisions and enhance the customer journey in the travel sector. You will be working with best in class technology and working within a wider motivated team of data analysts, engineers and scientists.

Our core data stack:

  • Front End Tracking: Google Analytics
  • CDP: Segment
  • CRM: Iterable
  • Data Storage: GCP & Snowflake
  • Data Visualisation and Usage: Tableau, Snowflake, Vertex AI
  • Orchestration: Airflow
  • Transformation: DBT
  • Synching data: Fivetran, Hightouch, Twilio Segment


WHAT YOU'LL DO üë©‚Äçüíª

  • Develop and maintain segments for personalised marketing campaigns based on customer behaviour, demographic data, and booking patterns.
  • Analyse CRM data to provide actionable insights on customer lifecycle, loyalty, and retention.
  • Collaborate with the mobile team to design, test, and optimize campaigns across multiple channels.
  • Monitor and report on the performance of CRM initiatives, providing regular updates to senior management on their impact on revenue and customer engagement.
  • Manage the integration of new data sources into the CRM system to ensure a holistic view of the customer.
  • Utilise advanced analytical techniques to predict customer behaviours and identify opportunities for growth and improvement.


WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR üëÄ

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field.
  • 2+ years of experience in CRM analytics or a related field, preferably in the travel or tech industry.
  • Strong analytical skills with experience in SQL, Excel, and CRM software (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot).
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
  • Knowledge of statistical modeling and data mining techniques is a plus.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
  • Proactive, detail-oriented, and capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
  • Knowledge of agile project management and familiarity with working alongside engineering teams to prioritize product enhancements.


WHAT WE OFFER üíØ

  • Competitive salary & benefits
  • Enhanced annual leave plus 3 Wellbeing Days per year
  • Paid family leave (maternity, paternity, surrogacy & adoption)
  • Agile working (plus a Working from Abroad Policy!)
  • Support for your ongoing growth & development
  • Inclusive people policies (sickness, menopause, compassionate and fertility leave)
  • A chance to give back to your local community with 5 paid volunteering days


We believe in talented and diverse teams that reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we operate. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences. We lay out the above requirements to guide applicants to the experiences that we believe will allow you to be successful in the role. If you don‚Äôt meet them all, please consider applying if you think you can still perform the role as described.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Data Analyst will work on a new product (UMD) of a global project focused on the evolution of third-party data ecosystems would aim to streamline the integration of new data and technologies such as data virtualization, APIs, etc., enhancing the accessibility and real-time availability of data across systems
UMD has the objective and ambition to build and deploy a matching solution live having as a target matching as a service capability with unique identification to all third parties publishing through the Businesses and locations (facilitating cross-selling, making Group-level reports reliable) and new data collection application delivered
The Data Analyst will be in charge of the quality, steering follow-up, building indicators, define and follow remediation actions (including potential architecture change ir new external data sources to be added)
A deep knowledge of banking activities & data (Referentials) knowledge, quality, follow and build indicators
The global aim of the project ensure high data quality and consistency across various REFERENTIALS data sources and reducing discrepancies in reporting and closing figures by performing a deep analyses on the existing data and sources and transform the processes and technologies used, including the existing REFERENTIALS. The goal is to streamline workflows, improving time to market and enabling faster and more accurate insights for better decision-making


Your Main Activities Are


Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management. Responsibilities
Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making.
Actively manage clients.
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining.
Coach as necessary more junior members of the team.
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholders


Profile And Skills To Success


Educational background: Information Technology & computer Science / Information Systems or Business Management
More than 4 years of Experience as Data Analyst or similar role
Professional experience in Referential administration (data management, database‚Ä¶) desirable;
Availability and customer orientation skills;
Strong analytical mind, problem solving, planning & organization skills.
Analytical and goal oriented;
Excellent attention to details, Rigour & Accuracy;
Pro-active attitude with ability to work in a fast changing and demanding environment;
Team spirit and at ease with multi-tasking;
Ability to report.
Strong interpersonal communication and presentation skills (spoken and written);
English is mandatory (B2 Level minimum);
French is a plus;
Proficiency in MS Office tools, Power BI, Tableau
Experience with databases and data management
Financial Data knowledge desirable
Client focus


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analysis HR Trainee (f/m/div)
Description:
Are you passionate about HR technology and digitalization? Do you want to kick-start your career with a team of Digital HR experts, in a dynamic and multicultural work environment, and support our Human Resources Digitalization? Look no further than our HR Digital team in Porto! You'll gain precious experience and be part of an exciting journey towards becoming a digital expert.

Job Description

As an HR Data Analysis Trainee, you will support the HR Digital team, located across various regions. You will play a crucial role in HR digitalization, influencing global HR processes and communicating with multiple stakeholders to implement our digital strategy for HR on a global scale.

In your new role, you will:


Develop new self-service data solutions, such as Certified Data Sources, Dashboards, or List Reports
Support data solutions as they go into sustain, namely by troubleshooting and bug-fixing, enhancing and maintaining features throughout the life-cycle, as well as enabling and supporting end-users
Managing relationships and relevant communication flows with stakeholders
Trend-scout and consult on data-related matters
Support HR and Business in taking better, faster, fact-based decisions, driving HR transformation even further


Your Profile

You have a proactive, structured, and autonomous working style. You have an excellent team spirit and a creative mindset. You possess great communication skills and are an artist when it comes to stakeholder management. You can think and act strategically and like to work on new concepts, where you can apply your technical knowledge, as well as your understanding of HR processes.

You are best equipped for this role if you have:


A degree in Data Science, Information Technology, Economics, Business Administration, Human Resources, or a similar field of study
Concrete knowledge and understanding of reporting solutions & data analysis process, acquired by your educational background and/or through hands-on experience (e.g., curricular internship)
Know how on Business Intelligence software ‚Äì both on data flows and visualization ends - preferably Tableau
Knowledge of HR processes is a plus
Fluency in English (mandatory). Knowledge of German is a plus


Please apply with your CV in English.

Contact:

Maria Julia Mello

#WeAreIn for driving decarbonization and digitalization.

As a global leader in semiconductor solutions in power systems and IoT, Infineon enables game-changing solutions for green and efficient energy, clean and safe mobility, as well as smart and secure IoT. Together, we drive innovation and customer success, while caring for our people and empowering them to reach ambitious goals. Be a part of making life easier, safer and greener.

Are you in?


Welcome to Infineon Technologies Business Solutions in Porto! - Infineon Technologies Business Solutions is a vibrant global hub, driven by diverse talents and an operational culture of excellence, in a privileged geographic location. The team of more than 25 nationalities works together in a dynamic, diverse and inclusive environment. We lead innovation and digital transformation, shaping the future of Infineon Technologies. At the heart of everything we do, people matter most. Our ultimate goal is to craft a unique experience for both our customers and employees.


At our site you will find a range of diverse teams that have built a reputation for delivering high-quality services for all Infineon in Finance, Procurement, Human Resources, IT, Audit, Legal, Compliance, Business Continuity and Sustainability, Cyber Security, Communication, Corporate Supply Chain Logistics and Sales & Marketing. Porto is a powerhouse of ideas and solutions, a key player in the global company‚Äôs puzzle, delivering specialized services and innovative solutions.

Together, Infineon Technologies Business Solutions will continue to shape the future, driving innovation and excellence for years to come.

We are on a journey to create the best Infineon for everyone.

This means we embrace diversity and inclusion and welcome everyone for who they are. At Infineon, we offer a working environment characterized by trust, openness, respect and tolerance and are committed to give all applicants and employees equal opportunities. We base our recruiting decisions on the applicant¬¥s experience and skills. Learn more about our various contact channels.

We look forward to receiving your resume, even if you do not entirely meet all the requirements of the job posting.

Please let your recruiter know if they need to pay special attention to something in order to enable your participation in the interview process.

Title: Financial Resources Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The Financial Resources Data Analyst plays an important and accountable role in providing support on the management of Global Markets Resources, namely Liquidity, Balance Sheet and Capital and the monitoring of future regulations.

The Financial Resources Data Analyst measures, allocates and optimizes Resources to ensure that the operational entity grows revenue, market share, and profitability in a sustainable way.

Your Main Activities Are


Collect, Prepare, consolidate data and Monitoring and keep track of Gaps on Global Markets Resources.
Responsible for database production and maintenance.
Assist on the preparation of presentations on topics related to Global Market resources.
Provides assistance to incoming requests from different regulators.
Responsible for producing GM Resources metrics, following a continuous improvement mindset (acquiring and building knowledge on the different business Lines, units and organization).
Develop knowledge on technical skills and apply those in order to efficiently perform the tasks.
Build knowledge and understanding on the 5 main types for Global markets and Help monitor those - Credit; Counterparty; Equity; Market; Operational.
Build knowledge and easiness in the main tools and software used by the team.


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelors/MSc in Economics, Finance and Accounting
Very good communication skills
Analytical ability, attention to details, autonomy
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork
Proactivity
Risk management - Risk analysis
Technical skills ‚Äì R, VBA and Python

Title: Risk Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

Within the Group RISK Function, the main mission of RISK CPBS is to manage credit risk, counterparty risk, market risk and operational risk within the Retail Banking perimeter, which covers CPBS entities (Domestic Markets, EM and Specialized Business):


Contribute to the implementation of a robust risk management framework within the scope,
Monitor and control risks on its perimeter, providing a dynamic and comprehensive analysis of all the risks incurred within its scope,
Ensure compliance with banking regulations in the risk area, in conjunction with the relevant functions within its scope.


Your Main Activities Are


Coordinate the various actions of implementation and data reliability actions within each project
Support targeted CPBS entities RISK teams in the management and governance of its projects and their implementation
Ensure the update of policies and monitor their operational implementation.


Supporting the Risk teams


Framework, planning and budgeting of work
Coordination and development of supporting materials in response to ad hoc requests from the Group (e.g. Stress Tests, ETS, CRR impact study)
Participate in the preparation of materials & minutes for project committees, steering committees and strategic committees (AQC)
Ensure the update of EM policies on non-performing loans, and coordinate cascading within EM entities and monitor operational implementation.
Production of adequate documentation in line with Group Documentation


As part of B-Ready program for the implementation of CRR3 guidelines,


Coordinate actions to ensure the sourcing of CRR3 data, and support EM entities in the certification phase of the calculation of the CRR3 RWA.
Integration of additional regulatory data into local systems required to calculate the RWA according to the Bale 4 standards.
Coordination of the certification phase (Dry Run) and support to entities for data verification, understanding and interpretation of results, as well as implementation of action plans.


Supporting the Risk CPBS central teams as a PMO on the Prudential Backstops project


Support entities for the shortfall computation, in respect of the timeline imposed by the regulator and by the Group.
Organize workshops with entities and ensure the minutes with the monitoring of action / decisions exchanges.
Collect, control and consolidate the shortfall computed by entities,
Lead the building of the forecast assumption of provisioning evolution.


Ensure the data collection for the Stress Test EBA 2023 and Stress Test CRE


Collect Group needs and share the instructions to EM entities
Monitor the progress of the work in relation to the plans imposed.
Provide support to EM entities in their collection work (prioritization, identification of alternative solutions in case of missing data


Coordinate The Data Reliability Actions Used To Meet The Calculation Needs Of IFRS9 Provisions (Stages 1, 2 And 3), Shortfalls Computation And More Generally On All Projects Monitored By The Team


Support BMCI in identifying data corrections/development, defining and operational monitoring of action plans with a view to improving reliability and data collection.
Monitor the correction actions and the implementation of IT roadmaps for data implementation, feeding and control.


Monitor the implementation of indicators & Risk dashboards


Monitoring the integration of UTP in the credit process, in the respect of the regulatory deliverables.
Maintenance of the UTP dashboard for monitoring UTP deployment.
Communicate and control the application of updated instructions.


Profile And Skills To Success


2/3 years of experience in same or related field
Data knowledge
Risk analysis
Culture Transformation Change Management
Process improvement
Project management
Active collaboration
Adaptability
English (mandatory): fluent
French (recommended): Operational


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

HTML:
About The Job

Within the Group RISK Function, the main mission of RISK CPBS is to manage credit risk, counterparty risk, market risk and operational risk within the Retail Banking perimeter, which covers CPBS entities (Domestic Markets, EM and Specialized Business):

  • Contribute to the implementation of a robust risk management framework within the scope,
  • Monitor and control risks on its perimeter, providing a dynamic and comprehensive analysis of all the risks incurred within its scope,
  • Ensure compliance with banking regulations in the risk area, in conjunction with the relevant functions within its scope.

Your Main Activities Are

  • Coordinate the various actions of implementation and data reliability actions within each project
  • Support targeted CPBS entities RISK teams in the management and governance of its projects and their implementation
  • Ensure the update of policies and monitor their operational implementation.

Supporting the Risk teams

  • Framework, planning and budgeting of work
  • Coordination and development of supporting materials in response to ad hoc requests from the Group (e.g. Stress Tests, ETS, CRR impact study)
  • Participate in the preparation of materials & minutes for project committees, steering committees and strategic committees (AQC)
  • Ensure the update of EM policies on non-performing loans, and coordinate cascading within EM entities and monitor operational implementation.
  • Production of adequate documentation in line with Group Documentation

As part of B-Ready program for the implementation of CRR3 guidelines,

  • Coordinate actions to ensure the sourcing of CRR3 data, and support EM entities in the certification phase of the calculation of the CRR3 RWA.
  • Integration of additional regulatory data into local systems required to calculate the RWA according to the Bale 4 standards.
  • Coordination of the certification phase (Dry Run) and support to entities for data verification, understanding and interpretation of results, as well as implementation of action plans.

Supporting the Risk CPBS central teams as a PMO on the Prudential Backstops project

  • Support entities for the shortfall computation, in respect of the timeline imposed by the regulator and by the Group.
  • Organize workshops with entities and ensure the minutes with the monitoring of action / decisions exchanges.
  • Collect, control and consolidate the shortfall computed by entities,
  • Lead the building of the forecast assumption of provisioning evolution.

Ensure the data collection for the Stress Test EBA 2023 and Stress Test CRE

  • Collect Group needs and share the instructions to EM entities
  • Monitor the progress of the work in relation to the plans imposed.
  • Provide support to EM entities in their collection work (prioritization, identification of alternative solutions in case of missing data

Coordinate The Data Reliability Actions Used To Meet The Calculation Needs Of IFRS9 Provisions (Stages 1, 2 And 3), Shortfalls Computation And More Generally On All Projects Monitored By The Team

  • Support BMCI in identifying data corrections/development, defining and operational monitoring of action plans with a view to improving reliability and data collection.
  • Monitor the correction actions and the implementation of IT roadmaps for data implementation, feeding and control.

Monitor the implementation of indicators & Risk dashboards

  • Monitoring the integration of UTP in the credit process, in the respect of the regulatory deliverables.
  • Maintenance of the UTP dashboard for monitoring UTP deployment.
  • Communicate and control the application of updated instructions.

Profile And Skills To Success

  • 2/3 years of experience in same or related field
  • Data knowledge
  • Risk analysis
  • Culture Transformation Change Management

  • Project management
  • Active collaboration
  • Adaptability

Title: Reporting Specialist - Porto, Portugal
Description:
Come and work with us.

We are looking for a talented and accomplished Reporting Specialist to join our team. The purpose of this role is to directly assist the reporting team by collecting and reporting all KPIs data from Foundever Operations, Supporting Departments and Leadership.

As a Reporting Specialist, Your Daily Responsibilities Will Include


Under limited supervision, prepare and maintain databases & statistical reports used in financial/quality/performance management decision-making.
Investigate and analyze data and decide upon alternatives to complete assignments.
Assemble and assess statistical information from system databases and other sources.
Independently plan, prepare and maintain business unit reports critical to organizational success/profitability and meeting client expectations.
Investigate, analyze and assess trends and campaign/brand activity.
Monitor, evaluate and assess unit productivity on a daily basis.
Communicate with the manager on a daily basis to resolve problems/issues, assess scores/trends and maximize efficiency.
Additional operations support duties as assigned.
Creation of ‚Äúad hoc‚Äù reports under short timelines
Takes personal responsibility to understand and comply with all company and client security requirements and policies.


To succeed in the role, you will need to have:


English C1 advanced level
Strong computer, communication and analytical skills.
Strong knowledge Microsoft Excel
Microsoft Access/Database skills appreciated
Power BI experience is highly valued
VBA knowledge/experience is highly valued
SQL knowledge/experience is highly valued
SAP Business Objects knowledge/experience highly valued
Data Architecture knowledge/experience is highly valued
Ability to collect and assess large sets of data, dashboard creation and KPI evaluation.
Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Ability to work with minimal supervision, make independent decisions and solve complex problems
Strong understanding of the call center industry and operations,
Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment,
Demonstrated ability to develop professional relationships and interact with all levels of internal and external clients.
Solution driven mindset
Must hold EU citizenship or valid work permit for Portugal
Be a local candidate or willing to relocate to Porto, Portugal
Availability to work 100% from our site in Porto


Education And Experience.


Minimum 1 year experience as Reporting Specialist or Real Time Analyst


Benefits.


Competitive wages
Paid professional training
Employee discounts
Private healthcare & dental insurance (after six months of employment)
Growth opportunities through various development programs
Fun and engaging company-wide initiatives, including our EverBetter wellness program
Job stability
Life-long skills and experience
Excellent work culture


Go further with Foundever¬Æ

We believe in memorable associate experiences. Here, you can improve your quality of life and grow your career.‚ÄØ

Apply today!
